system_information:

OS version: Windows 11, 22000.613
Graphics Chipset: AMD Radeon RX Vega 7
 
Monitor1 / FW: SE2719HR / M2F100

description:

2. On Full UI > Display Tab
3. Check the hyperlink text next to "Change the size of text, applications, and other items"

Expectation: Text should show "Settings".

OS version: Windows 11, 22000.613
Graphics Chipset: AMD Radeon RX Vega 7

Input Source: HDMI

1. Launch DDM
2. On Full UI > Display Tab
3. Click hyperlink after "Change the size of text, applications, and other items"
4. Check Which Monitor is selected from OS Display Settings.

Result: NB display is selected
Expectation: If only one external monitor connected, it will be automatically selected from OS Display Settings.

system_information:
DDM version: 2.0.0.69
PC1 model: Acer Predator PH315-54-72VQ
OS version: Win10(20H2)
Graphics Chipset: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Laptop GPU
 
Monitor1 / FW: SE2419H/M2F100

Input Source:  HDMI
description:

2.Launch DDM.
3.On Full UI > Color
4.Select Auto mode
5.In 2 DUTs, the same application sets different Preset modes.
6.Move the application from current DUT to another DUT.
7.Check Screen.

Result:  The Preset mode will not be applied.
Expectation: OSD should shows Preset mode assigned to the application by DDM.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.0] 關閉下載更新檔的動作不是立即的
title: [DDM Win 2.0] Close download of update file is not immediate.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.0.0.72
PC1 model:  Dell-Inspiron 3515
OS version: Windows 10, 19044.1645
Graphics Chipset: AMD Radeon Vega 8

Monitor1 / FW: UP2720Q / M2B106
Input Source: HDMI1
description:
1. Launch DDM
2. On Full UI > Settings icon > Update Tab
3. Click "Update" button
4. Check download progress
5. Close download then click "Update" again
6. Also check the following paths: C:\ProgramData\Dell Display Manager\SW tool

Result: 
1) If not run as administrator, when the download is canceled, the file still remains in the temporary folder.
2) If run as adminstrator, when the download is closed, the file still remains in the temporary folder a few second then disappear.
When the update button is clicked, having an update file in the temporary folder will cause DDM to determine that the update file exists.
Expectation: Click Close on Download, the update file should be deleted immediately.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.0] Automatic Startup沒有以Launch during PC startup最新設置info顯示Yes

system_information:

description:
1. Launch DDM.
2. On Full UI> Easy Arrange > Easy Memory. Click + to create.
3. When comes to Easy Arrange Profile Configuration Launch Option, select "Automatically launch by time set" and enable "Launch during PC startup".
4. Click finish, select this layout and check. 
5. Click + to create another layout. When comes to Easy Arrange Profile Configuration Launch Option, select "Auto-load at startup" and enable "Launch during PC startup".
6. Click finish. Then select this layout and check. 
7. Click on the step3 layout and check.

Result : 
Select "Automatically launch by time set"  info show "No".
Select "Auto-load at startup" info show "Yes".
Enable "Launch during PC startup" does not affect info results.
Expectation : If new layout during setup set to Enable for "Launch during PC startup", all previous layout will be set automatic startup to "No".

Expectation: According to case requirement, able to see icc/icm profile will be automatically pointed from OS Color management.

-Underscan
-Toggle Vision Engine

-Easy Arrange Recent
-USB-KVM-Switching between PCs

-USB-KVM-hotkey to toggle PIP position Hotkey
-Launch Menu Launcher
-Launch Main Menu

description:

"2. Dell [Product name] - [current preset mode]" - DUT2 (limited access - same as DDC/CI = off condition)
"3. Dell [Product name] - [current preset mode]" - DUT3 (limited access - same as DDC/CI = off condition)

description:

PC model : HP Elite Dragonfly G2
OS version : Windows10 Pro , 19044.1766
Graphics: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor1 / FW: P2419HC , M3B114
Input Source: C
description:
1. Connect DUT that does not support PIP/PBP or KVM. 
2. Launch DDM.
3. On Full UI > Input Source > Hotkeys page.
4. Change the hotkey to Alt+Q.
5. Enter the following hotkeys that is for PIP/PBP or KVM:
     Alt+W, Alt+Z, Alt+A, Alt+T, Alt+S, Alt+P, Alt+N, Alt+U

Result: The message show "This hotkey combination has been used by another Dell Display Manager function, do you want to continue to replace?"
Expectation: These funtion can be setting,and not show the message.

2. Full UI > KVM > USB KVM Setup Wizard
3. Set PC1 input other than active input then click Next button
4. Click Back button
5. Check if input of PC1 remain at the last selected by the user

Result: If PC1 does not select active input and go to next page then back, it will automatically select active input. Original selected input has been replaced. Moreover, active input is always selected by default, no matter in which PC setting page.
Expectation: Original selected input setting should be restored when clicking "Back" button.

Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

description:
Setup: Disable " Application Window Snap"

For Windows 11 only, please use different file to drag into different virtual desktop. Open same file in different virtual desktop will bring you back to 1st setup layout virtual desktop.

1. Launch DDM 
2. Press "Windows Key + Tab" to add 2 create virtual desktop  ('Desktop 2 and 3). 
3. After start with 'Desktop 1' and select one of the predefined layout from software close DDM Full UI/ Basic UI. 
4. Open a few windows, drag the window into each zone.
5. Repeat step 4 for 'Desktop 2' and 'Desktop 3'.
6. Open the full UI on Desktop 1, press "Windows key + Tab" to switch to Desktop 2 and "Desktop 3" and observe the screens.

Result : With Full UI open, switching any Virtual desktop will probability go back. 
Expectation : With the full UI open, should remain on the selected Virtual desktop

chinese: [DDM Win 2.0] Span across multiple monitors 關閉後無法回初始單台layout選擇
title: [DDM Win 2.0] Disable "Span across multiple monitors", the layout does not revert back to the each DUT original setting.
system_information:
DDM version : 2.0.0.110
PC1 model : Acer Predator PH315-54-72VQ
OS Name, version : Windows10 (21H2), 19044.1766
Graphics Chipset: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Laptop GPU

Monitor1 / FW: S3422DW / M3C103
Input Source:  C to DP (DA300)
Monitor2 / FW: S3422DWG / M3C105
Input Source:  HDMI
description:
1. DUT1 connects to PC1.
2. DUT2 connects to PC1.
  a) DUT1 & DUT2 are same size.
  b) DUT1 & DUT2 set to same resolution. In PC settings, This 2 monitor set to side by side.
  c)  Both DUT in extended mode and in landscape position.
3. Launch DDM
4. Select one predefined layout for each DUT and observe the screen. 
5. Go to Easy Arrange > Settings > Enable "Span across multiple monitors".
6. Select another predefined layout and open a few windows. Drag the window into each zone of the layout and observe the screen. 
7. Disable "Span across multiple monitors" and observe the screen.

Result : Layout stays on the last DUT selected by DDM.
Expectation : The layout should revert back to the one that set for each DUT in step 4.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.0] 連接2DUT時，啟用"Span across multiple monitors"，點選EA layout後，線框與layout不同(含旋轉也是)
title: [DDM Win 2.0] Multiple DUT connection, Enabling "Span across multiple monitors" and clicking easy arrange Layout will different from outline.
system_information:
DDM version : 2.0.0.116
PC model : Dell Latitude 9520
OS version :  Windows11 Pro(22H2), 22621.575
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics


Monitor1 /FW : P3223QE / M3T102
Input Source : USB-C
Monitor2 /FW : UP3221Q / M2B104
Input Source : HDMI
description:
1. DUT1 connects to PC1.
2. DUT2 connects to PC1.
  a) DUT1 & DUT2 are same size.
  b) DUT1 & DUT2 set to same resolution. In PC settings, This 2 monitor set to side by side.
  c) DUT1 & DUT2 set to same % in "Change the size of text, apps, and other items"
  d)  Both DUT in extended mode and in landscape position.
3. Launch DDM
4. Select one predefined layout for each DUT and observe the screen. 
5. Go to Easy Arrange > Settings > Enable "Span across multiple monitors".
6. Select another predefined layout and open a few windows. Drag the window into each zone of the layout and observe the screen. 

Result : "Change the size of text, apps, and other items" setting more than 100% will be different from outline.(contains portrait position)
Expectation : DUT1 & DUT2 set to same % in "Change the size of text, apps, and other items",will be same as outline.

system_information:

description:
Uniformity Compensation (if applicable)

1. Type following command 
Windows: DDM /WriteUC On

Result: WriteUC on = Error, In OSD, Uniformity Compensation didn't turn On
Expectation: Should be = ok, In OSD, Uniformity Compensation = On

P.S.
DDM 2.0 v116: If Type command: DDM /WriteUC on, then will feedback =error, OSD didn't turn on
DDM 2.0 v116: If Type command: DDM /WriteUC low, then feedback =ok, OSD didn't turn on
DDM 2.0 v116: If Type command: DDM /WriteUC high, then will feedback =ok, OSD turn on

Enteck 1.56.0.2107: If Type command: DDM /SetUC on, then will feedback =ok, OSD turn on
Enteck 1.56.0.2107: If Type command: DDM /SetUC low, then will feedback =ok, OSD didn't turn on
Enteck 1.56.0.2107: If Type command: DDM /SetUC high, then feedback =Invalid command, OSD didn't turn on

chinese:
[DDM Win 2.1] Single Display模式下可進行Multiple Display模式

(滑鼠可控制另台PC，複製貼上檔案)
title: [DDM Win 2.1] Multiple Display mode is available in Single Display mode.
system_information:
DDM version : 2.1.0.6
PC1 model : ASUS TUF Dash F15 FX516PM
OS Name : Windows 10 Home (22H2), 19045.1889
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics 
PC2 model : Dell-Precision 3560 
OS version : Windows 10 Pro (22H2), 19045.2006
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics
PC3 model : Acer Predator PH315-54-72VQ
OS Name, version : Windows10 (21H2), 19045.2006
Graphics Chipset: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 Laptop GPU
 

Monitor1 / FW : U2719DC / M3T107
Input Source1 : DP to C
Monitor2 / FW : U2722DE / M3B106
Input Source2 : C
description:
KVM Setup A:
a) DUT1 connects to PC1 and PC2.
b) All PCs connected to network port = 5567.
c) Keyboard and mouse connected to PCs and monitor. 

KVM Setup B:
a) DUT2 connects to PC1 and PC3.
b) All PCs connected to network port = 5567.
c) Keyboard and mouse connected to PCs and monitor.

1. In PC1, Setup Network KVM - Single Display with KVM Setup A Full screen. 
2. Unplug Setup A.
3. Connect Setup B now.
4. In PC1, add PC3 and change to any PBP screen. 
5. Switch back to setup A.

Result: Single Display mode can be used as part of the function of multiple display mode
(Can copy file and move the mouse)
Expectation: Multiple Display function should not be used in Single Display mode.

chinese: [DDM2.1] Unable to transfer file from PC 1 (windows 11) to PC2 (windows 10) and vice versa

system_information: DDM version: 2.2.0.39
description:
Steps to reproduce

1.Setup multiple monitors with Windows 10 PC connected to monitor via USBC and Windows 11 PC connected to monitor via DP
2.After setup, the mouse and keyboard appear normal but the file transfer appears busy because the cursor is still spinning and the temp file is still left behind on windows 10.
3.Copying files from windows 11 to windows 10 is unable to copy.
4.For Single 2 PBP, the mouse movement is not in the correct order as the PCs arrangement.  Need to swap around before the mouse movement works but the keyboard does not work on windows 11.  The mouse scroll button is also unable to scroll on windows 11 (the wireless mouse and keyboard are attached to windows 10)
5.On Windows 10, it is unable to click on the windows icon to shut down the PC.
上jira看圖

description:
1. Test with platform supports Modern Standby sleep mode.
2. OS version using Win10 22H2 and Win11 22H2 under test
3. Download ADK tool from Microsoft offical website
4. Follow the Dell testvault instruction to get the below parameters of Baseline and App under test.
    -Software DRIPS (%) 
    -DRIPS Delta (%) 
    -Exit (ms) 
5. Compare the result with below formula and do analysis
    -App: Software DRIPS (%) > Baseline: Software DRIPS (%)
    -App: DRIPS Delta (%) > Baseline: DRIPS Delta (%) = FAIL
    -App: Exit (ms) > Baseline: Exit (ms) = FAIL

Result: 
For Win11, one of result is always failed:  App: Exit (ms) > Baseline: Exit (ms) = FAIL
Expectation: Pass all Results Analysis

description:
1. Test with platform supports Modern Standby sleep mode.
2. OS version using Win10 22H2 and Win11 22H2 under test
3. Download ADK tool from Microsoft offical website
4. Follow the Dell testvault instruction to get the below parameters of Baseline and App under test.
    -Projected Time to Shutdown (min)
5. Compare the result with below formula and do analysis
    -(Baseline: Projected Time to Shutdown (min))*0.008 = Allowance (min)
    -If (App - Baseline) > Allowance (min) = FAIL

Result: 
For Win10&Win11, result is always failed:  (App - Baseline) > Allowance (min) = FAIL
Expectation: Pass all Results Analysis

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1]
title: [DDM Win 2.1] Windows Sleep Impact Test failed.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.0.0.137
PC model : Dell-Latitude 7320
OS Name, version : Windows11 22H2, 22621
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R)Xe Graphics

Monitor1 / FW: P2424HEB , 32T108
Input Source: HDMI
description:
1. Test with platform Not supports Modern Standby sleep mode.
2. OS version using Win10 22H2 and Win11 22H2 under test
3. Download ADK tool from Microsoft offical website
4. Follow the Dell testvault instruction to get the below parameters of Baseline and App under test.
    -Baseline: Total Suspend Duration(S1)
    -App: Total Suspend Duration(S2)
    -Baseline: Total Resume [Excluding BIOS] Duration(R1)
    -App: Total Resume [Excluding BIOS] Duration(R2)

5. Compare the result with below formula and do analysis
     -Subtract the Baseline Result (S1) from the App Result (S2)
     -If (S2-S1) > 0.150 seconds = FAIL
     - If (R2-R1) > 0.250 seconds = FAIL

Result: 
(S2) 1.955- (S1) 1.702 = 0.253(Seconds) >0.15 = Failed
(R2) 1.198-(R1) 1.253 = -0.055(Seconds)<0.25 = Pass

Expectation:  
(S2-S1) < 0.150 seconds
(R2-R1) <0.25 seconds

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1]
title: [DDM Win 2.1] Windows Startup Impact Test Test failed.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.0.0.137
PC model : Dell-Latitude 7320
OS Name, version : Windows11 22H2, 22621
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R)Xe Graphics

Monitor1 / FW: P2424HEB , 32T108
Input Source: HDMI
description:
1. Test with platform supports Modern Standby sleep mode.
2. OS version using Win10 22H2 and Win11 22H2 under test
3. Download ADK tool from Microsoft offical website
4. Follow the Dell testvault instruction to get the below parameters of Baseline and App under test.
5. Compare the result with below formula and do analysis
   -(Baseline: Total Reboot (Seconds)) * 0.05 = Reboot Difference Allowance
   -(App: Hiberfile Size (Megabytes)) - (Baseline: Hiberfile Size (Megabytes)) = Hiberfile Difference
   -(App: Boot Footprint (Megabytes)) - (Baseline: Boot Footprint (Megabytes)) = Footprint Difference

Result:
Shutdown Impact (Seconds) > 2.000 seconds
Expectation:  
Shutdown Impact (Seconds) < 2.000 seconds
Reboot Difference < Reboot Difference Allowance
Hiberfile Difference < Hiberfile Difference Allowance
Footprint Difference < Footprint Difference Allowance

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1] 當FW更新完成後的提示訊息顯示不正確
title: [DDM Win 2.1] After the FW update is successful the notification is displayed incorrectly.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.0.25
PC1 model: Dell latitude 9520
OS version: Window 11 Pro,  22621.819
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor / FW: U2422H / M3B102
Input Source: HDMI + C to A
description:
Setup:
1. Open command Prompt from PC. (search for "cmd")
2. Type following in command prompt: cd C:\Program Files\Dell\Dell Display Manager 2.1

Scenes1
1. Type following command to update FW: ddm /fwupdate defer
2. Plug in the monitor that HAVE FW update available.
3. System notification is displayed and click "Right now" button.
4. After the FW update is successful observe message.

Scenes2
1. Type following command to update FW: ddm /fwupdate force
2. Plug in the monitor that HAVE FW update available. 
3. After the FW update is successful observe message.

Result: "<model name>_<service tag> firmware update successfully "
Expectation:  System notification should displayed.
Updated the firmware for <model name>_<service tag> successfully.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1]
title: [DDM Win 2.1] The same model has through  MST, and only a prompt message will pop up after one successful one failed
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.0.25
PC1 model: Dell latitude 9520
OS version: Window 11 Pro,  22621.819
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor / FW: P2422HE
Input Source: HDMI + B to A or USB-C
description:
Setup: 
PC <> DUT1 
PC <HDMI/DP> DUT2
PC <USB upstream cable> DUT1 (if it's HDMI/DP connection)
DO NOT connect upstream cable for DUT2

1. Open command Prompt from PC. (search for "cmd")
2. Type following in command prompt: cd C:\Program Files\Dell\Dell Display Manager 2.1
3. Type following command to update FW: ddm /fwupdate force
4. User plug in the monitor that HAVE FW update available. 
5. After FW updated successfully observe the notification.


Result : after FW updated successfully/failed. 
System notification is displayed.
DUT1 - Updated the firmware for <model name>_<service tag> successfully.
DUT2 - Failed to update the firmware for <model name>_<service tag>.
Expectation:  There are only one prompt message will pop up after the FW update is successful.

title: [DDM Win 2.1] Display Firmware Update expected outcome.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.0.28
PC1 model: Dell Latitude 9520
OS version: Windows 10, 19045.2251
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor1 / FW: C2423H / 33B100
Input Source: HDMI + upstream
description:
1. Launch DDM
2. Testmode on
3. Full UI > Settings > Update > Firmware update
4. Click "Update" when update is avaliable
5. Click "Yes" when download is completed and ignore DDM notify
6. DDM pops up system notifcation "C2423H firmware is updating, DDM will resume after update finish" and hover on icon show "Please wait for the firmware update to complete".

Result: The expected behavior of each ISP is different. If DDM is executed.
1. C2423H ISP will pops up notification to remind the user to close DDM.
2. U2422H ISP will not check if DDM is executed and not pops up notification to remind the user to close DDM.
Expectation: Although it is possible to ignore the ISP to notify the user to close DDM, but it will cause confusion to the user, because when the firmware update is completed then manual launch DDM, it will prompt the update failed.

title: [DDM Win 2.1] When connecting 2 monitors, ISP tool have monitor information detect issue.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.0.28
PC1 model: Dell Latitude 9520
OS version: Windows 10, 19045.2251
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor1 / FW: C2423H / M3B103
Input Source: HDMI + upstream
Monitor2 / FW: C2423H / 33B100
Input Source: HDMI + upstream
or
Monitor1 / FW: C2423H / 33B100
Input Source: HDMI + upstream
Monitor2 / FW: U2422HE / M3B407
Input Source: HDMI + upstream
description:
1. Launch DDM
2. Testmode on
3. Full UI > Settings > Update > Firmware update
4. Click "Update" when update is avaliable
5. Click "Yes" when download is completed and ignore DDM notify
6. DDM pops up system notifcation "C2423H firmware is updating, DDM will resume after update finish" and hover on icon show "Please wait for the firmware update to complete".

Result: 
Direct connect: If is same model, the ISP follows input sequence to detect monitor information. If is different model, the ISP detects the last 3 numbers of the firmware, the largest will be detected result.
MST: The ISP detects the last 3 numbers of the firmware, the largest will be detected result.
Daisy chain: The ISP can't detect monitor information.
Expectation: When "Update" is pressed, the ISP tool should detects the corresponding monitor instead of the current latest firmware version monitor.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1] 啟用"Span across multiple monitors"，設定layout在DUT2後重啟，layout使用DUT1
title: [DDM Win 2.1] Enable Span monitor function, after PC restarting, screen shows unexpected DUT layout
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.0.30
PC1 model : ASUS TUF Dash F15 FX516PM
OS Name : Windows 10 Home (22H2), 19045.2364
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics 


Monitor1 / FW : U2722D / M3T102
Input Source 1 : HDMI
Monitor2 / FW : C2722DE / M3T108
Input Source 2 : C to DP
description:
Setup:
a) DUT1 connects to PC1.
b) DUT2 connects to PC1.  
c) DUT1 & DUT2 must be same screen size. 
d) In PC settings, Both monitor
   Set to side by side.
   Set to same resolution.
   Set to same % in "Change the size of text, apps, and other items"
   in extended mode and in landscape position.
1. Launch DDM
2. Full UI > Easy Arrange > Settings > Enable "Span across multiple monitors"
3. Full UI > Easy Arrange > Layout
4. Select DUT1 any layout, then select DUT2 any layout (All layouts, including custom layouts)
5. Perform Drag and drop.
6. Restart PC or DDM. Drag and drop into overlapping custom layout.

Result: Use DUT1 layout for the screen.
Expectation: DUT2 layout should be used.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1.1] cmd下了: ddmsetup /autostartup=on, DDM "Auto-load at startup" 會未被勾選

system_information:
DDM version : 2.1.1.4
PC1 model : HP Elite Dragonfly G2
OS version: Window 10 Pro,  19045.2486
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor1 / FW : UP2729QA / M2B101
Input Source : USB-C
description:
Test Setup: 
1. Make sure DDM is not pre-installed in the system.
2. Download latest DDM and unzip.


1. Open command Prompt from PC. (search for "cmd") 
2. Enter cd command to DDM unzip folder.
Example: cd c:\[folder name]
3. Type following command to install DDM by launching the .exe file:
scenario1: start ddmsetup /verysilent /autostartup=on
scenario2: start ddmsetup /verysilent /NotifyUpdate=false /autostartup=on
scenario3: start ddmsetup /verysilent /NotifyUpdate=true /TelemetryConsent=false /autostartup=on

Result: "Auto-load at startup" is unticked.
Expectation: "Auto-load at startup" is ticked.

DDM version: 2.1.0.45
PC1 model: Asus UX435EG
OS version: Windows 10 Pro, 19045.1889
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor / FW: P3223QE / M3T101
Input Source: USB-C
description:
1. Launch DDM
2. On Full UI > Easy Arrange >  Layout
3. Select "Microsoft Office" software and any layout
4. Dragging folders into layout and check gap in between
5. On Full UI > Easy Arrange  >  Settings page
6. Toggle "Allow application to snap side by side without gap" ON/OFF
7. Check gap between folders 

Result : "Microsoft Office" software "Allow application to snap side by side without gap" is not working.
Expectation : "Microsoft Office" software "Allow application to snap side by side without gap" should work normally.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1.1] import OSD後DUT沒有保持在當前的input source.
title: [DDM Win 2.1.1] After command to import OSD settings DUT not stay in current input source.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.1.1
PC1 model :HP Elite Dragonfly G2
OS version: Window 10 Pro,  19045.2486
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics
 
Monitor1 / FW : P2724DEB / 32T140
Input Source : USB-C
description:
Setup:
a. Open command Prompt from PC. (search for "cmd")
b. Type following in command prompt:cd C:\Program Files\Dell\Dell Display Manager 2

1. Launch DDM and Command Prompt.
2. Type following command to export OSD settings:Windows: DDM /ExportOSD C:\temp\OSDsettings.bin
3. Unplug the monitor(DUT1) and connect another same model monitor(DUT2) but different service tag with USB upstream cable.
Change some settings in OSD in MMS Level 0 and 1 based on excel in #2 "Monitor Sync Table Revision 1"
4. Type following command to import OSD setting:Windows: DDM /ImportOSD C:\temp\OSDsettings.bin
5. Check the items copied over in DUT2.


Result:  DUT2 not stay in current input source.
Expectation: DUT2 still stay in current input source.

chinese: [DDM2.1.1] PC下載.NET6非最新版後安裝DDM，.Net6會被更新到最新版本
title: [DDM Win 2.1.1] After installing DDM, .Net6 will install the latest version.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.1.1
PC1 model: Asus UX435EG
OS version: Windows 10 Pro, 19045.1889
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor / FW: P3223QE / M3T101
Input Source: USB-C
description:
Setup:
1. Pre-installed not the latest version for .NET 6 
2. Make sure DDM is not pre-installed in the system.

1. Install DDM.
2. After DDM installation, Go to Control Panel > Programs > Programs and Features. 
Search for "Microsoft Windows Desktop Runtime" and check the .NET version.

Result : .Net6 will install the latest version after installing DDM.
Expectation : .NET 6 version remains the same as the latest, no changes.

Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3070 8GB GDDR6

chinese: [DDM2.1.1] Arbitrary Folders-Files Deletion vulnerability with the Dell Display Manager 2.1 Installer
title: [DDM2.1.1] Arbitrary Folders-Files Deletion vulnerability with the Dell Display Manager 2.1 Installer
description:
Using the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.1 installer (version 2.1.0.45) is possible to perform arbitrary Files/Folders Deletion.
The only requirement is to have limited code execution privileged (as Authenticated users) in order to abuse this vulnerability during the uninstall and possible the upgrade process.

Description:
Using the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.1 installer (version 2.1.0.45)Installer is possible to perform arbitrary Files/Folders Deletion.
The only requirement is to have limited code execution privileged (as Authenticated users) in order to abuse this vulnerability during the uninstall and possible the upgrade process.
This can be achieved by creating specific a mountpoint which can be linked to dedicated folders in order to create Denial of Service, reduce the security controls of the system (Applocker policies, removal of files associated to AV solutions) or create a condition that the attacker can abuse the gain higher privileges.

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Download the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.1 installer:

Details URL:
https://www.dell.com/support/home/nl-nl/product-support/product/dell-display-manager-2.0/drivers

Download URL:
https://dl.dell.com/FOLDER09478708M/1/ddmsetup.exe?uid=299570dd-7fb3-460e-0c0a-7e4b0faa2ef2&fn=ddmsetup.exe

The SHA-2 of this file is:
Name: ddmsetup.exe
Size: 66879816 bytes (63 MiB)
SHA256: 961681fee17ae7bd9c0f6b751d386ccf215ef6928c530934004d6fa4ca48cffc

2.Install the Dell Display Manager application.

3.As the Administrator account we will create a folder structure since we do not want to alter the current state of the OS.

4.Run the following command from an elevated cmd.exe:
mkdir C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\sample

5.Copy some files and folders in that folder and check their permissions.

6.Validate that indeed only high privileged accounts are allowed to perform actions on these files (Modify/Delete).
These files are going to be deleted so please make sure you use only sample files.

7.As a low privileged account Create the mountpoint using the following commands:
mklink /j "C:\ProgramData\Dell Display Manager\demo" C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\sample

8.Start the uninstall process from the Programs and Features console.

9.The mountpoint was removed and also the content from C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\sample folder.

The test was perform on Windows 10 Pro Version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.2486) x64 version

-CVSSv3 Vectors : https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.0#CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:H

Impact
This issue could potentially allow an non-privileged local account, or process, to perform Arbitrary Files/Folders deletion as Administrator.
This can be achieved by creating a specific mount point which can be linked to dedicated folders in order to create :
-Denial of Service
-Reduce the security controls of the system (Applocker policies, WDAC policies, removal of files/folders associated to AV solutions)
-Create a condition that the attacker can abuse the gain SYSTEM privileges.

chinese: [DDM2.1.1] Local Privilege Escalation with the Dell Display Manager 2.0/2.1
title: [DDM2.1.1] Local Privilege Escalation with the Dell Display Manager 2.0/2.1
description:
Using the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.0 installer (version 2.1.0.45) is possible to perform arbitrary file creation allowing a low privileged account to perform privilege escalation to SYSTEM.

The only requirement is to have limited code execution privileged (as Authenticated users) in order to abuse this vulnerability during the install/repair process, and possibly during the upgrade as well.

Description:
Using the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.0 installer is possible to perform arbitrary file creation allowing a low privileged account to perform privilege escalation to SYSTEM.

The only requirement is to have limited code execution privileged (as Authenticated users) in order to abuse this vulnerability during install/repair process.
This can be achieved by creating specific a symlink which can used to create specific file with over permissive ACL allowing Privilege Escalation to SYSTEM

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Download the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.0 installer:

Details URL:
https://www.dell.com/support/home/nl-nl/product-support/product/dell-display-manager-2.0/drivers

Download URL:
https://dl.dell.com/FOLDER09478708M/1/ddmsetup.exe?uid=299570dd-7fb3-460e-0c0a-7e4b0faa2ef2&fn=ddmsetup.exe

The SHA-2 of this file is:
Name: ddmsetup.exe
Size: 66879816 bytes (63 MiB)
SHA256: 961681fee17ae7bd9c0f6b751d386ccf215ef6928c530934004d6fa4ca48cffc

2.Make sure the software is not installed.

3.As the low privileged account we will create a folder:
mkdir "C:\Poc"

4.As a low privileged account, extract the attached poc_arb_file_creation.zip into the newly created folder.

5.You should have the following files in this folder:
start_cmd_x64.DLL - sample DLL that will start a cmd.exe when loaded
CreateSymlink.exe - complied executable from from https://github.com/googleprojectzero/symboliclink-testing-tools/tree/main/CreateSymlink
poc_arb_file_creation.ps1 - Powershell script to help with the validation of this vulnerability.

6.As a low privileged account, start the poc_arb_file_creation.ps1

This script will do the following activities:
-Create the C:\ProgramData\Dell Display Manager\ folder
-Create a symbolic link that points "C:\ProgramData\Dell Display Manager\ddm.ini" to "C:\Program Files\Common Files\microsoft shared\ink\HID.DLL"
-Wait for the installer to follow the symbolic and remove it once the "C:\Program Files\Common Files\microsoft shared\ink\HID.DLL" is created
-Copy the sample DLL that will be executed when On-Screen Keyboard from the Secure Desktop is started

7.Start the install process as an Administrator account.

8.After the installation is complete, lock the windows session and start the On-Screen Keyboard from the Secure Desktop.

9.You will receive a cmd.exe as SYSTEM.
This can be checked by running the whoami /all in the cmd.exe

The test was perform on Windows 10 Pro Version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.2486) x64 version

I have attached the attached poc_arb_file_creation.zip and also a video to help with the validation steps and clear any things I might have missed in the report.

-CVSSv3 Vectors : https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.0#CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

Impact
Using the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.0 installer (version 2.1.0.45) is possible to perform arbitrary file creation allowing a low privileged account to perform privilege escalation to SYSTEM.

chinese: [DDM2.1] Incorrect regional time format sent to Telemetry and resulted in messages dropped in dead letter queue
title: [DDM2.1] Incorrect regional time format sent to Telemetry and resulted in messages dropped in dead letter queue
description:
Steps to reproduce

     1.Change the setting of region which is in HH.mm.ss time format, eg. Danish(Greenland)
Data received in platinum server

Events received by Platinum:

{"EUID":"41c364a3-8d76-406d-b19b-79fd7ccc8915","ESTS":"2023-01-19 06:07:03.704","ETT":"SW","ET":"AppSession","EV":"AppStarted","TS":"2023-01-19T06:06:46.7748466Z","SN":"W55BDV9","ST":"W55BDV9","MFR":"Alienware","PN":"Alienware m18 R1","OCD":"2023-01-03 01.06.15.932","OSSku":"48","GeoId":"126","OSVer":"10.0.22621","LC":"da-DK","AppKey":"97A4C44F-D789-414D-A65F-7A607528E100","DAID":"aba44635-006e-4cc2-8831-afbaad1d3717","AppVersion":"2.1.0.36","SV":"1.0.0.0","SRC":"DAPI-1.0.0.0"}
 

{"EUID":"3f7d5499-c8ae-440c-b93b-3b5eafe28901","ESTS":"2023-01-19 06:07:06.816","ETT":"SWC","ET":"Device_Type_Connected","EV":\{"VideoPortInUsed":"1","DisplayModelname":"AW2523HF","ConnectedType":"DP","DisplayServiceTag":"BS1HGH3"}
,"TS":"2023-01-19T06:06:51.2104418Z","SN":"W55BDV9","ST":"W55BDV9","MFR":"Alienware","PN":"Alienware m18 R1","OCD":"2023-01-03 01.06.15.932","OSSku":"48","GeoId":"126","OSVer":"10.0.22621","LC":"da-DK","AppKey":"97A4C44F-D789-414D-A65F-7A607528E100","DAID":"aba44635-006e-4cc2-8831-afbaad1d3717","AppVersion":"2.1.0.36","SV":"1.0.0.0","SRC":"DAPI-1.0.0.0"} 

Error logged in Platinum for above messages:

"ex":"MVSException","em":"Value for OCD:2023-01-03 01.06.15.932 is not acceptable as DateTime value is expected."


Same device has sent following event successfully where language is fr-FR

{"EUID":"077cadd6-b3a6-4f9a-bbfa-19e5e5b7f2e2","ESTS":"2023-01-19 06:43:53.199","ETT":"SW","ET":"AppSession","EV":"AppStarted","TS":"2023-01-19T06:43:35.737131Z","SN":"W55BDV9","ST":"W55BDV9","MFR":"Alienware","PN":"Alienware m18 R1","OCD":"2023-01-03 01:06:15.932","OSSku":"48","GeoId":"126","OSVer":"10.0.22621","LC":"fr-FR","AppKey":"97A4C44F-D789-414D-A65F-7A607528E100","DAID":"aba44635-006e-4cc2-8831-afbaad1d3717","AppVersion":"2.1.0.36","SV":"1.0.0.0","SRC":"DAPI-1.0.0.0","EventEQ":"1/19/2023 6:43:53 AM","EventProcessed":"1/19/2023 6:43:53 AM"}
 

 

Root cause:

Because Win DDM generates OobeDate using ToString("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.fff") method.

From the ToString(String) method returns the string representation of a date and time value in a specific format that uses the formatting conventions of the current culture


Solution

 [ToString(String, IFormatProvider) [method as ToString("yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.fff", new CultureInfo("en-US")) to fix this error.

chinese: [DDM2.1] Telemetry consent is not disabled after switching different user accounts
title: [DDM2.1] Telemetry consent is not disabled after switching different user accounts
description:
Steps to reproduce

1.Install DDM2.1.0.45 with command line - ddmsetup.exe /verysilent /autostartup=off /telemetryconsent=disable ./notifyupdate=disable
2.After installation, launch DDM on different user accounts on the system by switching user accounts
3.It is observed that not all the telemetry option is disabled for all users.  One of the user account did not disable telemetry and prompted user to consent/do not consent.
 

Fixes also need to roll into DDM2.1 stable release branch in addition to DDM2.1.1 branch.

description:
Setup:
Please connect USB upstream cable if connection is DP/HDMI.

1. Type following command to export OSD settings:
Windows: DDM /ExportOSD C:\Users\[User1_name]\Documents\OSDsettings.bin
2. Unplug the monitor(DUT1)
3. Type following command to import OSD setting:
Windows: DDM /ImportOSD C:\Users\[User1_name]\Documents\OSDsettings.bin
4. Restart PC. 
5. Plug the monitor(DUT2) with USB upstream cable if it's HDMI/DP connection. 
DDM prompts:"Do you want to import settings for [Model_Name]?" Click Yes and export successfully. 
6. Check the items copied over in DUT2.
7. Change to other input source for DUT2. Change to all available input source in DUT2.
8. Switch another user account(User2), Connect another monitor same model(DUT3).

Result: After switch another user account, access to the path is denied.
Expectation: After switch another user account, access to the path is apply to all users.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1.1] 用 CLI 安裝 DDM會彈出提示信息
title: [DDM Win 2.1.1] Install DDM with CLI, the prompt message pop up.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.1.15
PC: Inspiron 5415
OS version: Win11 (Home)  22621.1413
Graphics Chipset: AMD Radeon(TW) Graphics  

Monitor: SE3223Q, M2C102
Input Source: HDMI
description:
Scenario 1:
 Setup:
 1. Open "Registry Editor"
 2. Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\DeviceAccess 
 3. Double click "ActivePolicyCode", enter "zh" under value data.  
 4. Click OK.

1.  Open command Prompt from PC. (search for "cmd") 
2. Enter cd command to DDM unzip folder. ( cd c:\[folder name] )
3.  Install DDM with CLI.
 a. start ddmsetup /verysilent /NotifyUpdate=false /TelemetryConsent=true
 b. start ddmsetup /verysilent /NotifyUpdate=true /TelemetryConsent=disabled
 c. start ddmsetup /verysilent /NotifyUpdate=disabled /TelemetryConsent=false

scenario 2:
 Setup:
 1. Open "Registry Editor"
 2. Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\DeviceAccess
 3. Double click "ActivePolicyCode", enter "ZH" under value data. 
 4. Click OK.

1.  Open command Prompt from PC. (search for "cmd") 
2. Enter cd command to DDM unzip folder. ( cd c:\[folder name] )

chinese: [DDM WIn 2.1.1] Import settings command 預期行為.
title: [DDM WIn 2.1.1] Import settings command expect behavior.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.1.15
PC1 model: Dell Latitude 9520
OS version: Windows 10, 19045.2728
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor1 / FW: C2423H / M3B103
Input Source: C to C
description:
1. Connect monitor (1) and (2) to platform (1) and (2)
2. Execute cmd on platform (1)
3. Enter pre-command for ddm (cd, console start)
4. Enter "DDM /ExportSettings C:\Users\[User1_name]\Documents\DDMsettings.json"
5. Put DDMsettings.json file to platform (2)
6. Execute cmd on platform (2)
7. Enter pre-command for ddm (cd, console start)
8. Enter "DDM /ImportSettings C:\Users\[User1_name]\Documents\DDMsettings.json"
9. Pop up import dialog then click "Yes" 
10. All import steps are completed and the DDM status is normal
11. Disconnect monitor (2) on platform (2)
12. Enter "DDM /ImportSettings C:\Users\[User1_name]\Documents\DDMsettings.json"
13. Connect monitor (3) on platform (2)

Result: According CLI test cases No.70 step.4, It should pop up same dialog as step.2, but after connect monitor (3), DDM pop up detected new monitor dialog.
The detected new monitor dialog triggered when enter import settings command then connect same model, If not selected Yes or No to close dialog, everytimes connect same model will prompt detected new monitor dialog.

If selected No, console report:
ImportSettings C:\Users\CE\Documents\DDMsettings.json = Failed. No monitor 
if Yes, console report:
ImportSettings C:\Users\CE\Documents\DDMsettings.json Ok.

If close detected new monitor dialog then enter import settings command again will correctly pop up no check box import dialog.
Expectation: It should only pop up no check box import dialog.
PS.
Connect monitor then type import command, will show https://www.screencast.com/t/mC5XdPg0

type import command then connect monitor, will show https://[www.screencast.com/t/XWuRkiXT

chinese: [DDM Win 2.2] 關閉 Allow content transfer後，傳輸檔案失敗後，沒有顯示訊息。
title: [DDM Win 2.2] After turning off Allow content transfer, no message is displayed after file transfer failed.
system_information:
DDM version : 2.2.0.7
PC1 model : Dell Latitude 9520
OS version:  Windows 11 Pro (22H2) 22621.1413
Graphics: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics
PC2 model : HP Elite Dragonfly G2

Monitor1 / FW : UP2720QA , M2B101
Input Source1 : DP

Monitor2 / FW : U3023E , M3T101
Input Source1 : C to DP
description:
Multiple Display - Do not Allow Content Transfer

Scenes1: 
Setup: 
a) DUT1 and DUT2 connect to PC1.
b) DUT3 connect to PC2.
c) All PCs connected to same local network.
d) Keyboard and mouse connected to PCs and monitor.

Scenes2:
Setup:  
a) DUT1 and DUT2 connect to PC1.
b) DUT3 connect to PC2.
c) All PCs connected to same WIFI network.
d) Keyboard and mouse connected to PCs and monitor.
e) PC with antivirus software:
    - PC1 is installed with McAfee
    - PC2 is installed with TrendMicro 

Scenes3:
Setup:  
a) DUT1 and DUT2 connect to PC1.
b) DUT3 connect to PC2.
c) All PCs connected to cross subnet. 
(example 
Corporate Company WIFI
PC1 IP: AAA.BBB.CCC.XXX
PC2 IP: AAA.BBB.DDD.YYY)
d) Keyboard and mouse connected to PCs and monitor.
e) PC with antivirus software:
    - PC1 is installed with Norton 
    - PC2 is installed with TrendMicro 

Scenes4:
Setup:  
a) DUT1 and DUT2 connect to PC1.
b) DUT3 connect to PC2.
c) All PCs connected to same network. PC1 with ethernet cable, PC2 with WIFI.
d) Keyboard and mouse connected to PCs and monitor.
e) PC with antivirus software:
    - PC1 is installed with Norton 
    - PC2 is installed with McAfee

Step:
1. Start DDM.
2. Set up network KVM wizard and add another PC.
3. Click "Manage Cluster" and uncheck "Allow Content Transfer".
4. Transfer files to another PC.
5. Check notifications.

Result : No message was displayed. (for window 11)
Expect : Display "The content transfer between PCs in the network KVM is not enabled. Please make sure you turn on the feature before you transfer again."

chinese: [DDM2.2]-U2724D&U2424H Easy Arrange function error(No message pops up.&The layout will not be restored.&The file name does not show the path.&Easy memory shows wrong behavior)
title: [DDM2.2]-U2724D&U2424H Easy Arrange function error(No message pops up.&The layout will not be restored.&The file name does not show the path.&Easy memory shows wrong behavior)
system_information:
FW:13T102

DDM:2.2.0.2

Input:DP&HDMI

EQ:U2424H-Dell 7071&U2724D-Dell 7540
description:
U2724D&U2424H 

#135 Custom layout - Save layout with Easy memory Profile associated

1. Choose Software > Main Menu > Easy Arrange > Easy Memory, select a layout to create a configuration file, and remember the layout.

2. Choose > Main Menu > Easy Arrange > Layout, select the same layout as Step 1, and click the pencil icon to edit it.

3. Click save.

4. Create a simple memory with Step 2 Custom layout.

5. In the customized layout, click the pencil icon to edit the layout, as shown in Step 2.

6. Adjust the line and click the Save button.

Without a message prompt, Case requires a pop-up message: "There are Easy Memory profiles associated to this custom layout. Saving this custom layout will update the layout for." There are easy memory profiles associated to this custom layout. Saving this custom layout will update the layout for all the associated profiles. Do you want to save the layout? "

5.3 Settings

#145 Only allow zone positioning when SHIFT key is pressed

Connection : DUT1 connects to PC1. DUT2 connects to PC1.

Select different pre-defined layout:DUT1 and DUT2 both show the same layout

#147 Span across multiple monitors

1. Select a predefined layout for each DUT and observe the screen.

2. Choose Easy Scheduling > Settings > Across Multiple Monitors.

3. Enable Across Monitors.

4. Select another predefined layout and open several Windows. Drag the window to each area of the layout and observe the screen.

5. Restart the PC and drag the folder to the layout.

6. Disable Across Multiple Monitors and observe the screen.

Disable Across multiple Monitors and watch the screen, and the layout will not revert to the layout you set for the DUT in Step 1.

5.4 Window layout from Right click DDM icon

#153,155-156 Auto Restore window layout
1.Right click on DDM icon in tasktray. Click on "Auto-restore window layout" to enable/disable.
2. Now move the folder to any position of the monitor.
3. Unplug the video cable and plug it back after 5 sec, observe the screen.
"Auto-restore window layout" to enable/disable,After plug back the cable, the windows restore back to the layout per step 2

5.5 Easy Memory
#159 Select app/document for pre-defined layout
1. Open software > main menu > Easy Arrange > Easy Memory. Click + to create profile.
2. Click next after profile name entered and pre-defined layout selected.
3. Now in App/Document page, click the "+".
4. Select any from the list and click OK or "Select From Folders".
5. Repeat to add for all windows.
6. Check all files' name.
in App/Document page, click the "+", Select APP from the list ,Check all files' name,The file name does not show the path.
#162 Launch during PC startup = Yes
1. Open software > main menu > Easy Arrange > Easy Memory. Click + to create.
2. Click next until launch option.
3. Tick "Launch during PC startup". Check the message displayed.
4. Click Finish. Check the Profile info.
5. Restart PC. 
Restart PC, No easy memory profile is launch after PC startup.
#167&168 Easy Memory - Span multiple monitors
Test connection:
a) DUT1 connects to PC1.
b) DUT2 connects to PC1.  
c) DUT1 & DUT2 must be same screen size. 
d) In PC settings, Both monitor，Set to side by side，Set to same resolution，Set to same % in "Change the size of text, apps, and other items"
  in extended mode and in landscape position.
1.  Select one predefined layout for each DUT and observe the screen. 
2. Go to Easy Arrange > Settings > Span across multiple monitors.
3. Enable "Span across multiple monitors".
4. Create easy memory profile with "Enable "Launch during PC startup" for DUT1 and DUT2. 
5. Select DUT2 and apply easy memory layout. 
6. Exit DDM/DDPM and launch DDM/DDPM. Drag the file and check the layout.
7. Restart PC. Check easy memory launch.
Create easy memory profile with "Enable "Launch during PC startup" for DUT1 and DUT2,Select DUT2 and apply easy memory layout, Restart PC.
The "easy memory" text is displayed in DUT1.

U2424H only

#128 Pre-defined layout
Connection :  a) DUT1 connects to PC1.b) DUT2 connects to PC1.
DDM software Select a layout. In DDM software, the layout of DUT1 and DUT2 is the same.

U2724D only

#152&154 Select "Restore saved window layout". The window layout is not restored

chinese: [DDM Win 2.2] Auto select 可以被Import到另一台螢幕
title: [DDM Win 2.2] Auto select is turned on after import the bin file with Auto Select USB-C is "Yes".
system_information:
DDM version: 2.2.0.7
PC1 model: Dell Percision 3560
OS version: Win10 Pro, 19045.2846

Monitor1 / FW: P2724DEB / 32T149
Monitor2 / FW: P2724DEB / 32T149
Input Source1: C to DP +B to A 
Input Source2: C to DP +B to A
description:
1. Monitor1 auto select for USB-C select "YES".
2. Type following command Monitor1 to export OSD settings: DDM /ExportOSD C:\temp\OSDsettings.bin
3. Unplug the monitor(DUT1) and connect another same model monitor(DUT2) but different service tag.
4. Monitor2 auto select for USB-C select "NO" and turn off auto select.
5. Type following command Monitor2 to import OSD setting: DDM /ImportOSD C:\temp\OSDsettings.bin
 
Result: Auto select is turned on after import the bin file 
Expectation: Auto select should not import and auto select for USB-C can import.

5. "Type DDM /ExportOSD C:\temp\OSDsettings_HDMI.bin" on Command Prompt to WAKE UP DDM.

Result: DDM show error message and fail to export OSD settings, no bin file is created in the temp file. 
Expectation: Monitor settings export successfully.

P.S (If didn't close DDM from step2, it will pass)

chinese: [DDM2.1.1]Local Privilege Escalation with the Dell Display Manager 2.1.1.17 - Dell Display Manager
title: [DDM2.1.1]Local Privilege Escalation with the Dell Display Manager 2.1.1.17 - Dell Display Manager
description:
Description:
Using the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.1 installer (version 2.1.1.17 ) is possible to perform EXE hijacking allowing a low privileged account to perform privilege escalation to Administrator and subsequently to SYSTEM.

The only requirement is to have limited privileged (as Authenticated users) in order to abuse this vulnerability during install/repair process.
This can be achieved by storing a malicious EXE file which will be executed insecurely by the installer.
To be more exact the installer is trying to execute the cmd.exe from C:\ProgramData\Dell Display Manager\ folder.

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Download the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.1 installer:

Details URL:
https://www.dell.com/support/home/en-us/product-support/product/dell-display-manager-2.0/drivers

Download URL:
https://dl.dell.com/FOLDER09820521M/1/ddmsetup.exe?uid=56b0c686-4a61-4c58-e27d-d3324ac0d6b5&fn=ddmsetup.exe

The SHA-2 of this file is:
Name: ddmsetup.exe
Size: 67800928 bytes (64 MiB)
SHA256: 6c3574839c1a3509a5dc554e1531fa707977c1b807a9e481f425f987f0739f6f

2.Make sure the software is not installed.

3.As the low privileged account we will create a folder:
mkdir "C:\Poc"

4.As a low privileged account, extract the attached poc_display.zip into the newly created folder.

5.You should have the following file in this folder:
poc_display.ps1 - Powershell script to help with the validation of this.

6.As a low privileged account, start the poc_display.ps1.

This script will do the following activities:
-Create the C:\ProgramData\Dell Display Manager\ folder
-Create a copy of the C:\WINDOWS\system32\CompMgmtLauncher.exe in the folder named cmd.exe (this is to validate and confirm that the cmd.exe is executed).

7.Start the install process as an Administrator account.
Note: This needs to be interpreted as the Administrator is a different person, that starts the installation, and not the low privileged attacker.

8.As soon as the installer gets executed, the Computer Management will get executed.

9.Start a cmd.exe by selecting Action -> Export list and navigate to c:\windows\system32, right click and select "Run As Administrator".
10.Execute whoami /all, in the cmd.exe, and you should be able to determine that:
The account is member of the BUILTIN\Administrators
The Mandatory Label is High Mandatory Level

The test was perform on Windows 10 Pro Version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.2728) x64 version

I have attached the attached poc_display.zip and also a video to help with the validation steps and clear any things I might have missed in the report.

-CVSSv3 Vectors : https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.0#CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H

Impact
Using the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.1 installer (version 2.1.1.17 ) is possible to perform EXE hijacking allowing a low privileged account to perform privilege escalation to Administrator and subsequently to SYSTEM.

chinese: [DDM2.1] Security Vulnerabilities
title: [DDM2.1] Security Vulnerabilities
description:
Using the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.1 installer (version 2.1.1.17) is possible to perform arbitrary Files/Folders Deletion.
The only requirement is to have limited code execution privileged (as Authenticated users) in order to abuse this vulnerability during the install process.

Description:
Using the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.1 installer (version 2.1.1.17) Installer is possible to perform arbitrary Files/Folders Deletion.
The only requirement is to have limited code execution privileged (as Authenticated users) in order to abuse this vulnerability during the install process.
This can be achieved by creating specific a mountpoint which can be linked to dedicated folders in order to create Denial of Service, reduce the security controls of the system (Applocker policies, removal of files associated to AV solutions) or create a condition that the attacker can abuse the gain higher privileges.

Steps To Reproduce:
1.Download the latest version of Dell Display Manager 2.1 installer:

Details URL:
https://www.dell.com/support/home/en-us/product-support/product/dell-display-manager-2.0/drivers

Download URL:
https://dl.dell.com/FOLDER09820521M/1/ddmsetup.exe?uid=56b0c686-4a61-4c58-e27d-d3324ac0d6b5&fn=ddmsetup.exe

The SHA-2 of this file is:
Name: ddmsetup.exe
Size: 67800928 bytes (64 MiB)
SHA256: 6c3574839c1a3509a5dc554e1531fa707977c1b807a9e481f425f987f0739f6f

2.As the Administrator account we will create a folder structure since we do not want to alter the current state of the OS.

3.Run the following command from an elevated cmd.exe:
mkdir C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\sample

4.Copy some files and folders in that folder and check their permissions.

5.Validate that indeed only high privileged accounts are allowed to perform actions on these files (Modify/Delete).
These files are going to be deleted so please make sure you use only sample files.

6.As a low privileged account Create the mountpoint using the following commands:
mklink /j "C:\ProgramData\Dell Display Manager\" C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\sample

7.Start the install process. This step is going to be performed by the Administrator.

8.The mountpoint was removed and also the content from C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc\sample folder.

The test was perform on Windows 10 Pro Version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.2728) x64 version

-CVSSv3 Vectors : https://www.first.org/cvss/calculator/3.0#CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:L/UI:R/S:U/C:N/I:H/A:H

Impact
This issue could potentially allow an non-privileged local account, or process, to perform Arbitrary Files/Folders deletion as Administrator.
This can be achieved by creating a specific mount point which can be linked to dedicated folders in order to create :
-Denial of Service
-Reduce the security controls of the system (Applocker policies, WDAC policies, removal of files/folders associated to AV solutions)
-Create a condition that the attacker can abuse the gain SYSTEM privileges

description:
1. software version is installed.
2. Exit the DDM.
3. Open cmd from PC. (search for "cmd")
4. Type following in cmd; C:\Program Files\Dell\Dell Display Manager 2
5. Type following in cmd; ddm /testmode on
6. Open Software, change some hotkey, color auto mode setup.

8. Click Update button > Click Close button. 
9. Click on Update button again and wait for it to download complete.

Items that set in Step 1 still persist. It's not reset to default settings.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.2]EAM所設定的程式如果有Command Prompt,排在它後面開的程式會等異常久.

system_information:
DDM version: 2.2.0.13
PC: Latitude 7320
OS version: Windows 11 Pro

Monitor1 /FW: U2724DE /33T106
Input Source1: DP
description:
Setup: The user has created a profile with the "Command Prompt" application.

Test Steps: 
1. Open software > main menu > Easy Arrange > Easy Memory. Click + to create. 
2. Select 4 windows layout. Click next.
3. Select app for each 4 window. Click next button.
**The key step is to select the "Command Prompt" application.
4. Click finish with Select "Manually select the profiles created". 
3. Click apply button.

Result: 
All the apps opened after the "Command Prompt" will take a long time.

Example:
1.Paint 2.Command Prompt 3.Calculator 4.Microsoft Edge > Then, 3.Calculator and 4.Microsoft Edge takes almost 2 minutes.
1.Paint 2.Microsoft Edge 3.Calculator 4.Command Prompt > As "Command Prompt" is the last app to open, won't be a long wait.

Expectation: The profile launch should work more smoothly.

description:
Setup: Use PC with ARM processor support.

1. Use PC with ARM processor support, download latest DDM, unzip the DDM folder and open it.

Scenes1
1. Right click on the ddmsetup.exe file > Properties > Compatibility, under Windows on ARM > select "Change emulation settings > change the following settings and apply. Untick "Hide x64 emulation capability (x86 apps only)"

Scenes2
1. Right click on the ddmsetup.exe file > Properties > Compatibility, under Windows on ARM > select "Change emulation settings > change the following settings and apply. Tick "Hide x64 emulation capability (x86 apps only)"

2. Check software installation is blocked and a message will be shown: "Dell Display Manager does not support ARM processor."

Result: There is nothing happen.
Expectation: Installation is blocked and a message will be shown "Dell Display Manager does not support ARM processor."

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1.1] 用CLI安裝DDM"Help Dell improve its products and services automatically." 沒被勾選.
title: [DDM Win 2.1.1] Install DDM with CLI the Analytics Tab item is unticked.
system_information:
DDM version : 2.1.1.26
PC1 model : XPS 9710, 
OS Name : Win11 Pro, 22621.1702
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R UHD Graphics


Monitor1 / FW : P2724DEB, 32T151
Input Source1 : USB-C
description:
Setup:
1. Open "Registry Editor" 
2. Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\DeviceAccess 
3. Double click "ActivePolicyCode", enter "ZH" under value data.  
4. Click OK.

1. Install DDM with CLI.  (uninstall previous DDM if have existing DDM in system)
start ddmsetup /verysilent /NotifyUpdate=false /TelemetryConsent=true 
2. Launch DDM. 
3. Click No. 
4. Go to main menu > Settings.

Result:  Analytics Tab - "Help Dell improve its products and services automatically." is untick.
Expectation: 
Check following items:
a) General Tab - "I give permission for Dell Display Manager to access data through network if necessary." is untick. 
b) Update Tab - "Automatically notify when update is available" is untick.
c) Analytics Tab - "Help Dell improve its products and services automatically." is tick.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1.1] 使用 CLI 安裝 DDM 勾選General tab item, Update tab item 還是保持未勾選
title: [DDM Win 2.1.1] After installing DDM using CLI and ticking the General tab item the Update tab item remains unticked.
system_information:
DDM version : 2.1.1.26
PC1 model : XPS 9710, 
OS Name : Win11 Pro, 22621.1702
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R UHD Graphics


Monitor1 / FW : P2724DEB, 32T151
Input Source1 : USB-C
description:
Setup:
1. Open "Registry Editor" 
2. Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\DeviceAccess 
3. Double click "ActivePolicyCode", enter "ZH" under value data.  
4. Click OK.

1. Install DDM with CLI.  (uninstall previous DDM if have existing DDM in system)
start ddmsetup /verysilent /NotifyUpdate=true /TelemetryConsent=disable
2. Launch DDM. 
3. Click Yes.
4. Go to main menu > Settings.
5. Go to General tab, untick "I give permission for Dell Display Manager to access data through network if necessary.", click OK. 
6. Go to General tab, tick "I give permission for Dell Display Manager to access data through network if necessary.", click OK.


Result: ticking the General tab item the Update tab item remain untick.
Expectation: 
Check following items:
a) General Tab - "I give permission for Dell Display Manager to access data through network if necessary." is tick.
b) Update Tab - "Automatically notify when update is available" is tick. 
c) Analytics Tab - "Help Dell improve its products and services automatically." is greyed out.

2.Mouse will be stuck at the screen and unable to move and recover
3.If user use the internal keyboard to response the UAC prompt, the connection will be disconnected
4.An additional PC appears on the PC that keyboard/mouse is attached to
5.Attempt to reconnect 192.168.1.139 but failed (DDM on this PC has crashed)

2.The additional PC should not show up
jira看圖

chinese: [DDM2.1] Unable to reconnect after the connection is disconnect
title: [DDM2.1] Unable to reconnect after the connection is disconnect
system_information: DDM windows version 2.1.0.6
description:
Steps to reproduce:
1.Setup multiple display configuration (one Windows PC and one Mac)
2.Both PCs are connected to a monitor
3.Once the mac or windows Pc is disconnected, while attempting to reconnect, PIN will pop up at the other PC but no where to enter the PIN
4.In which, there is no way to recover the cluster but to resetup.
5.User resetup but failed to scan for the mac book from windows 10 PC
6.User entered IP address to search for the PC, the Enter IP hangs even thought it appears to connect because the mouse and keyboard are unable to cross over and use on MAC
7.When returning to the main network KVM, the PC is indeed connected.
8.Last used cluster is not default instead of defaulting to NONE - confuse user and lead to unnecessary cluster created
9.With the latest release 3, the mouse and keyboard are unable to move from mac to windows.

Expected Behavior:
1.Should be able to resume the connection since it is still within the same cluster without requiring PIN
2.PIN should only appear once but it is observed there are times 2 PINs is generated during reconnect from the PC icon
3.Should default to the last used cluster if none of the clusters are active
 
[Note: The connection is also not stable.  Check the log as it is easily disconnected when the PC is still active]

chinese: [DDM2.1] Unable to resume network KVM after system hibernation/sleep/locked screen
title: [DDM2.1] Unable to resume network KVM after system hibernation/sleep/locked screen
description:
Steps to reproduce:
1.Setup 2 PCs with multiple monitors
2.After putting one of the PCs to sleep, hibernate or locked screen
3.The PC is disconnected from the cluster as expected

Observation:
1.The PC is not auto resumed after the PC wakes up from sleep, hibernation or locked screen (see logs on the resume failed and unable to find client)
2.User reconnects manually but also can't reconnect from both windows 10 and 11 (both PCs are in multiple displays and hence no expect to throw wrong cluster)
3.User resetup the cluster, the auto resume from sleep still does not work but it works after manually reconnects.

Note: Using the setup wizard to scan again, it is able to connect after entering IP (although it indicated unable to find the PC).

Expected Behaviors:
1.Resume the connectivity automatically
2.preferably the mouse and keyboard can use on the login screen
上jira看圖

description:

Steps to reproduce:
1.User navigates to change account type or task manager or event viewer
2.The mouse will start to disappear and keyboard is unable to use.  Even if the mouse did not disappear, it is unable to click the close button.  These apps appear to hang until terminating from the task manager.
3.System is locked and user auto-connects (it is good that the mouse is able to mouse over to the disconnected PC but not the keyboard on the login screen). 

Unexpected behaviors:
1.DDM hangs (see logs for the unhandled exception)
2.It is observed that the network settings are removed after the app crashed.  It is required to resetup
3.All other network KVM on other PCs will need to setup again even after the 1st PC has connected with PC2
4.After file transfer, the temporary file is still left behind
上jira看圖
5. It is also observed it is unable to launch DDM2.1 main menu as it allows multiple instances running in the task manager
6. DDM on windows 11 also disappears from system tray.
7. When the screen is locked, it is required to reconnect.  However it is noticed that reconnection is not stable. Currently there are instances whereby the disconnects happens right reconnect.  Sometimes it might hang because the Windows 11 crashed.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1.1] 韌體已成功更新訊息沒有彈跳出
title: [DDM Win 2.1.1] "Updated the firmware successfully" message did not pop out.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.1.26
PC: Dell Inspiron 7510
OS: Win 11 Home

Monitor / FW: P2422HE, M2B205
description:
Scenario#1
SETUP: DELL INSPIRON 7510/WIN 11 HOME
PC > USB C cable > DUT1 
PC > HDMI + USB A to C cable > DUT2

ddm /fwupdate defer

1. Type command on CMD: ddm /fwupdate defer
2. Click Right now button.
3. After FW updated successfully. System notification is displayed "Updated the firmware for [P2422HE]_[service tag] successfully".
4. notification is displayed after PC reboot

Scenario#2
SETUP: DELL INSPIRON 7510/WIN 11 HOME
PC > USB C cable > DUT1 
PC > HDMI + USB A to C cable > DUT2

ddm /fwupdate force

1. Type command on CMD: ddm /fwupdate force
2. Click Right now button.
3. After FW updated successfully. System notification is displayed "Updated the firmware for [P2422HE]_[service tag] successfully".
4. notification is displayed after PC reboot

Scenario#3
SETUP: MST
PC > USB C cable > DUT1 > DP cable + USB A to C cable > DUT2
ddm /fwupdate force

1. Type command on CMD: ddm /fwupdate force
2. System notification is displayed. 
An update is available for P2422HE. Please connect the monitor via USB cable directly to the PC for updating your monitor.
Next, System notification is displayed. Updating the firmware for P2422HE. The app will resume after completion.
3. notification is displayed after PC reboot

P.S: System notification displayed just after PC reboot.
Result: "Updated the firmware successfully" message did not pop out. 
Expectation: System notification "Updated the firmware for P2422HE_[service tag] successfully." should be displayed after FW updated successfully.

chinese: [DDM2.1.1] NSIS Temp Folder Security Issues
title: [DDM2.1.1] NSIS Temp Folder Security Issues
description:
Steps to reproduce

1.Lack of Folder Validation leads to Denial of Uninstallation
High-Level Understanding: The folders “Un_A.exe to Un_Z.exe” used in the POC are used to compromise the application logic because the installer creates exe with the same name and since we have already created the folders with the same name, the uninstallation fails persistently.

 

2. Arbitrary files deletion due to Symlink

For demo purposes, we created a folder in Program Files (x86) directory, put some files in it, and used that folder as the target for Symlink. As soon as the uninstallation starts, we need to halt the uninstallation on the first screen, delete the folder which is created with the random name(2 folders are created. One has a constant name and the other has a random name), make a Symlink, and then resume the installation)

 

3. Arbitrary file creation due to Lack of Symlink verification

We have found one more issue which is “Arbitrary file creation using Symlink”. We are able to write a file in the “C:\Windows\System32”, which is a restricted directory. The installer creates a folder with the standard name “~nsuA.tmp”. The standard user can create a Symlink, point it to the restricted directory, and then initiate uninstallation. As soon as the uninstallation starts, a file “Un_A.exe” gets written in the restricted directory.

 

4. Arbitrary file deletion due to lack of Symlink Verification

In the temp folder, due to lack of ACL permission, attacker can exploit the folder by creating the junction right after the folder is created by the installer.  It will result in elevated privilege escalation.

5. User data did not copy only required data.

During the upgrade, installer moves the files from program data or app data to new appdata\local folder. However it moves the symlink along and not only whitelisted files.

 

6. User can create a symlink on user data folder and all the files are copied to the symlink target.

Because there is a gap between symlink deletion and folder creation, attacker has opportunity to exploit to recreate the symlink.

 

DDM_Revalidation_2.1.1.29 - OneDrive (sharepoint.com)  -> the actual videos are available in the folder

https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1Cw-RYG4e060Y8P7jkglqWvq04SRRtufD9WOCcKo-sB4/edit#gid=2129582849
測試結果填在4841那頁

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1.1] "Span across multiple monitors" 的預期行為
title: [DDM Win 2.1.1] Expected behavior for "Span across multiple monitors".
system_information:
DDM version: 2.1.1.31
PC1 model: Dell Latitude 9520
OS version: Windows 10, 19045.2965
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor1 / FW: C2423H / M3B104
Input Source: HDMI
Monitor2 / FW: C2423H / M3B104
Input Source: C to HDMI
description:
1. Launch DDM
2. Full UI > Easy Arrange > Layout
3. Select one predefined layout for each DUT
4. Full UI > Easy Arrange > Settings > Enabled "Span across multiple monitors"
5. Select another predefined layout (DUT2)
6. Restart DDM
7. Observe the screen if is still remembered by DDM and able to drag into it
8. Disable "Span across multiple monitors", the layout should revert back to the one that set for each DUT in step.3.

Result: 
(1) Step.7: Observe the screen is DUT1 layout currently, not the step.5 selected layout on DUT2.
(2) After disabled "Span across multiple monitors", the layout doesn't revert back to before enabled "Span across multiple monitors" set for each DUT.
Expectation:
(1) It should display step.5 layout no matter what DUT selected.
(2) The layout should correctly revert back to set for each DUT in step.3.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.1.1] 使用 CLI 安裝 DDM 勾選General tab item,  Analytics tab item 還是保持未勾選
title: [DDM Win 2.1.1] Ticking the General tab item the Analytics tab item remain untick.
system_information:
DDM version : 2.1.1.31
PC1 model : XPS 9710
OS Name : Win11 Pro, 22621.1702
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R) UHD Graphics


Monitor1 / FW : UP2720Q, M2B107
Input Source1 : USB-C
description:
Setup:
1. Open "Registry Editor" 
2. Go to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\DeviceAccess 
3. Double click "ActivePolicyCode", enter "ZH" under value data.  
4. Click OK.

1. Install DDM with CLI.  (uninstall previous DDM if have existing DDM in system)
start ddmsetup /verysilent /NotifyUpdate=disable /TelemetryConsent=false
2. Launch DDM. 
3. Click Yes and Go to main menu > Settings.
4. Go to General tab, untick "I give permission for Dell Display Manager to access data through network if necessary.", click OK.
5. Go to General tab, tick "I give permission for Dell Display Manager to access data through network if necessary.", click OK.

Result: Ticking the General tab item the Analytics tab item remain untick.
Expectation: 
Check following items:
a) General Tab - "I give permission for Dell Display Manager to access data through network if necessary." is tick.
b) Update Tab - "Automatically notify when update is available" is greyed out.
c) Analytics Tab - "Help Dell improve its products and services automatically." is tick.

chinese: [DDM 2.2] Incorrect brightness and contrast value when press and hold hotkeys for Brightness +/- and contrast +/-
title: [DDM 2.2] Incorrect brightness and contrast value when press and hold hotkeys for Brightness +/- and contrast +/-
system_information:
PC/OS: XPS 9510/Win 10 Pro

Monitor/FW: U2424HE/33B101
DDMv2.2.0.11
description:
1.Open software > Brightness and contrast > Hotkey > Assign hotkeys for brightness +, brightness -, contrast + and contrast -.
2.Press and hold the hotkeys for brightness + for few seconds and release hotkeys.
The brightness value will be more than 100%.
3.Press and hold the hotkeys for brightness - for few seconds and release hotkeys.
The brightness value will become negative value which is less than 0%.
4.Press and hold the hotkeys for contrast + for few seconds and release hotkeys.
The contrast value will be more than 100%.
5.Press and hold the hotkeys for contrast - for few seconds and release hotkeys.
The contrast value will become negative value which is less than 0%.
請上jira看圖片

description:
1.Network KVM is set up beforehand.
2.Install DDM using exe file and during installation unchecked 'Yes, I would like to install this feature.' on the Network KVM option page. 
3.Go to KVM page and check.
Actual results: KVM Page is showing greyed out (Disabled).
4.Select 'Setup wizard'.
Actual results: Network KVM option is still there.
5.Select Network KVM and continue to set up.
Actual results: An error message is showed saying: "KVM start FAILED: Service 'ShareMouseService' was not found on computer '.'."

chinese: [DDM2.1] Unable to auto resume after hibernation
title: [DDM2.1] Unable to auto resume after hibernation
system_information: no
description:
Steps to reproduce

1.Setup multiple display network KVM
2.Change the configuration to 2 PBP side by side network KVM
3.Put the system to hibernation
4.Resume from hibernation
5.Unable to resume network KVM because it returns to the multiple display instead of Single Display

Expected Results

1.Stay on single display last used
2.Resume from the PC
3.To improve the network KVM usage, add the connect, disconnect and changing the cluster on menu launcher as network KVM might not be able to resume in some instances

chinese: [DDM2.1] PBP layout does not reflect on the network KVM on main menu and menu launcher
title: [DDM2.1] PBP layout does not reflect on the network KVM on main menu and menu launcher
description:
Steps to reproduce

1.Setup 'Single Display' network kvm configuration through setup wizard
2.Leave the existing 4 PBP layout as is
3.The network KVM wizard disappears after attempting to auto connect
4.Change to 3 PBP layout from input source or configure screen
5.The actual pbp layout is changed but the pbp layout on network kvm is not reflected.
 

Observation and expected behavior

1.User never gets to see the auto connect or multi connect confirmation page (network kvm with confirmation message on top) -> this page is important to serve as the setup completion with confirmation message. The message should only shown when at least 2 pcs are connected to form a cluster.
2.The pbp layout does not reflect on main menu or menu ** launcher after changing the pbp layout >> it should reflect after monitor setting is updated
3.Switching the pbp video position, the arrow key does not response or response is slow. -> it should switch the video when clicking on the arrow key.
4.Spinner might require for any resume activities requires more than 1s to ensure responsiveness to the app.
5.Without right click, user can connect or disconnect using the button other than the right click.

上jira看圖

chinese: [DDM Win 2.2] DP lane 測項不同螢幕之間的相關性問題
title: [DDM Win 2.2] DUT correlation issue on Debug - Read Symbol Error for DP Lane 0 - 3
system_information:

OS Name : Windows 11 Home (22H2), 22621.1992
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R) UHD Graphics

Monitor/FW: P2223HC/M2B102 & P2422HE/M3B204
Input Source1: USB-C
description:
1. USB-C connect from platform to DUT
2. Debug mode on
3. Type following command to read  Symbol Error for DP Lane 0 - 3:
     Windows: DDM /DebugRead F3 03
4.  When no error, 00 will be displayed for each DPCD address. 
     When error happens on that moment, it will be any value other than 00. 

Result:
P2223HC/M2B102: debugread f3 03 = 000000008A008F00  (error)
P2422HE/M3B204: debugread f3 03 = 0000000000000000 (no error)

Expectation: When no error, 00 will be displayed for each DPCD address.

description:
1. Connect a DUT 
2. Change some OSD settings
3. Launch DDM
4. Launch CMD and order "ddm /exportosd C:\temp\osdsettings.bin" command
5. Connect 3 DUT with MST connection
6. Order "ddm /importosd C:\temp\osdsettings.bin" command
7. Click "yes" button
8. Check all DUT OSD 

Result:

Issue2- The visual color is incorrect in "Custom Color" mode after import.(the "Custom Color" values are correct in OSD, but it's not applied)
Expectation: 
Issue1- All items in MMS Level 0, 1 and 2 based on excel in #3 "Data Enumeration" in are imported same as OSD export settings
Issue2- The visual color is correct in "Custom Color" mode after import.

P.S : U2724D , U2424HE are the same issue

chinese: [DDM Win 2.2.1] 拔掉DUT2立刻插上DUT1時，DDM不會斷線
title: [DDM Win 2.2.1] On Network KVM, after switching Setup configuration, original setup does not be disconnected
system_information:
DDM version : 2.2.1.2
PC1 model : ASUS TUF Dash F15 FX516PM
OS Name : Windows 10 Home (22H2), 19045.3208
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics
PC2 model : HP-Elite Dragonfly G2
OS Name : Windows 10 Pro (22H2) 19045.3208
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics
PC3 model : DELL OptiPlex 5090
OS Name : Windows 11 Pro (22H2), 22621.1992
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R) UHD Graphics 750

Monitor 1/FW: U2520DR / M3B103
Input Source1: HDMI
Input Source2: C to DP
Monitor 2/FW: U3023E / M3T102
Input Source1: HDMI
Input Source3:  DP
description:
KVM Setup A:
a) DUT1 connects to PC1 and PC2.
b) All PCs connected to same network. PC1 with ethernet cable, PC2 with WIFI.
c) Keyboard and mouse connected to PCs and monitor.

KVM Setup B:
a) DUT2 connects to PC1 and PC3.
b) All PCs connected to same network.
c) Keyboard and mouse connected to PCs and monitor.

1. In PC1, Setup Network KVM - Single Display with KVM Setup A Full screen.
2. Unplug Setup A.
3. Connect Setup B now.
4. In PC1, add PC3 and change to any PBP screen.
5. Switch back to setup A. (Immediately plug and unplug the input port.)


Result: DDM will not disconnect. DDM maintains the setup B and will not automatically return to setup A

DDM version: 2.2.0.25

Input Source2: mDP
Input Source3: TBT
Input Source4: TBT
description:
1. Launch DDM
2. Toggle on or off "Enable Display matrix control" on any monitor
3. Check all monitor "Enable Display matrix control" status
4. Change Brightness / Contrast or Luminance monitors with hotkey

Result: "Enable Display matrix control" status sync all monitors.
If toggle to enabled on Brightness / Contrast monitor, It can sync with Brightness / Contrast monitors, but after you change to Luminance monitor will not take effects with hotkey.
If toggle to enabled on Luminance monitor first, It only take effects on Luminance monitors with hotkey.
It need to be disabled on any monitor then switch to which monitor you want to sync and enabled it.
Expectation: It can correctly take effects on all monitor with hotkey.

chinese: [DDM Win 2.2] 啟用"Enable display matrix control"，更改G series的preset mode，DUT反應不正常

system_information:
DDM version : 2.2.0.25
PC1 model : HP-Elite Dragonfly G2
OS Name : Windows 10 Pro (22H2) 19045.3208
Graphics Chipset : Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor/FW: S2319HS / M2T101
Input Source1: C to DP
Monitor/FW: G2723H / M2T101
Input Source1: HDMI
description:
1. Connect with 2 DUT
2. Launch DDM
3. Full UI > Brightness/Contrast > Manual > Enable  "Synchronize between monitors"
4. 
(a) Open DUT1 (S2319HS) Full UI > Color > Manual > set Movie mode(DUT2 not support preset mode) , and check all DUT OSD
(b) Open DUT2 (G2723H) Full UI > Color > Manual > set Game1,Game2,Game3,FPS Game,RTS Game,RPG Game,SPORTS Game mode(DUT1 not support preset mode) , and check all DUT OSD

Result:
(a) DUT1 shows movie mode, DUT2 changes preset color and OSD shows "null value"
(b) Except for Game1 mode, DUT1 retains the original settings ; DUT2 will not apply DDM settings
Expectation: Preset mode changes will apply to all monitor and OSD if the color preset selected is available for both monitor. Otherwise, preset mode will not sync and changes will only apply to the selected monitor.
