Monitor / FW: U2723QE / M2T104
Input Source : HDMI
Input Source : C to DP
description:
Test case: Network KVM Setup, Step 70-5,72-5

1. Launch DDM > Complete Network KVM settings > add PC2
2. Click Add PC button.
3. Enter PC2's IP Address.
4. On PC1, enter the wrong PIN code. Repeat this step for 10 times.
Observe Network KVM function on PC1 and PC2.
5. On PC2, Go to KVM Settings > Network > Network KVM.
Wait for 24 hours after lock, it will automatically unlock. Do not have to unlock. Enter the wrong PIN code again.

Result: Network KVM function will be locked (cannot be used). 
A window notification will be prompted.
Expectation: On PC2, Network KVM function will be resumed (work as normal).

Epic : MDDM-800
User story reference : MDDM-5785

system_information:

PC model:  Thena NQ DVT2 -Inspiron 7441

description:
Test Case : Firmware update using CLI #7~21 & 23 ~ 25 & 48

1. Connect DUT(AW3225QF/ M2B103) have FW update available to PC.
2. Type following command to update FW.
     Windows: ddm /fwupdate defer or ddm /fwupdate force
3. Check the DDM app notification.

Result:   Using ARM platform, DDM application notification does not pop up after type cmd.
Expectation: Using ARM platform, DDM app notifications should pop up after type cmd.

Note : 
1.  After this phenomenon occurs, enter the update tab to see that the firmware update button is not displayed.
2. This phenomenon only appears on ARM, not Intel.
3.  AW2725DF (FW :M3B102）has the same problem

system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.1.7
PC1 model : XPS 9310
OS version : Widows 11 Pro (22H2) 22621.3447

description:
Test case : Network KVM Connectivity #9-12

Scenairo1:
1. Setup: 
a) DUT supports PBP.
b) One DUT connects to 2 PCs through different input port.
c) All PCs connected to same network.
2. Open Software > Main Menu > KVM > 2 PBP windows > proceed until completion.
3. Use "Restore the mouse cursor to a local computer." hotkey on:
 With mouse cursor on PC2 PBP screen.
External keyboard connected to DUT.

Result: The mouse cursor back to PC1's screen. (Probability: 1/10) 
Expectation: The mouse cursor should be back to PC2's screen.

Scenairo2:
1. Launch DDM.
2. Setup Network KVM with full screen.
3. Set ""Restore the mouse cursor to a local computer"" hotkey.
4. PC1, PC2 uses the Extend mode.
5. Use ""Restore the mouse cursor to a local computer"" hotkey.


Result: 1. Unable to move the mouse to the main display of PC2.  (Probability: 1/10) 
2. Screen is not show mouse.  (Probability: 1/10) 
Expectation: You can move the mouse to the main display of PC2 and then screen show mouse.

pims:
與RD確認後非issue, 因系統的限制 CMD不關閉手動刪除也會失敗
做此步驟解安裝時須將CMD/資料夾關閉

Initial Network setup:
PC1 - Cluster A(PC1,PC3), Cluster B(PC1,PC2)
PC2 - Cluster B(PC1,PC2) =>disconnected
PC3 - Cluster A(PC1,PC3) =>connected

Step:
1. On PC1,delete Cluster B
2. On PC2, click PC1 connect
2. Enter PC1 PIN code
3. Click OK button

However, if Cluster A is disconnected, entering the pin code from PC2 will successfully PC1 connect Cluster B.

description:
Test case:  OSD - Cloning through DDM step:34 
Setup:
PC <video cable + USB upstream**> DUT <video cable only> MTK scalar monitor support OSD 
cloning & MMS

1. Open command Prompt from PC. (search for "cmd")
2. Type following in command prompt:
    "cd C:\Program Files\Dell\Dell Display Manager 2"
3. Change some sttings on OSD,and type following command: 
    "DDM /ExportOSD C:\temp\OSDsettings.bin"

Step:
1. Launch DDM
2. Type "DDM /importOSD C:\temp\OSDsettings.bin"
3. Click "yes"
4. Check Screen

Result: There is no signal on any DUT. Note that this issue only occurred on ARM PCs (failure rate: 2/3).
Expectation: DUT has signal.

chinese: [DDM 2.3.1] - Release 13 :下完CLI重新開機後, 插入DUT1 FW更新成功, 接著切換User, 用Switch user而不是Sign Out, 再插入DUT2後FW更新失敗

system_information:

Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) UHD Graphics

Input Source : USB-C

Input Source : USB-C
description:
Test case: Firmware update using Step 8-9 ,11-8

Test Steps:
1. Type following command to update FW and check DDM app notification.
    (Step 8: ddm /fwupdate defer ; Step 11: ddm /fwupdate force)
2. Restart PC.
3. Plug in DUT1 HAVE FW update available (FW: M2B207).
4. Click Right now button and check DDM app notification.
5. Open DDM > Main menu > Settings icon > Update. (FW: M2B208).
6. Open DDM > Main menu > ? icon. Check the monitor firmware. (FW: M2B208) 
7. Open OSD > Others > Firmware. Check the monitor firmware. (FW: M2B208)
8. Switch another user account using "Switch User" mode.
9. Plug in DUT2 HAVE FW update available (M2B207). 

Result: DUT2 FW has not update and DDM Notification show Failed msg as attached file.
Expectation: DUT2 FW update successfully.

note: Switch another user account using "Sign Out" mode will Pass.

chinese: [DDM 2.3.1] - A-Can :匯入設定後Color的手動設定統一會被調整成"Custom Color"
title: [DDM 2.3.1] - A-Can:  After importing settings from CLI, the color preset will be set to "Custom Color".
system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.1.11
PCmodel:Dell Precision 7560
OS version : Windows 10 Pro (22H2),19045.4170
Graphics Chipset: NVIDIA T1200 Laptop GPU

description:
Test Case: Command Line Interface #71 Step 3 #72-73 Step 2

1. Open CMD > enter cd C:\Program Files\Dell\Dell Display Manager 2.
2. Enter ddm /console start > wait for the DDM console to start.
3. After booting, return to CMD input
    "DDM /ExportSettings C:\temp\DDMsettings.json"
4. Confirm whether there is a DDMsettings.json file under C:\temp\
5. Modify some DDM settings, brightness, color, hotkeys....
   (For color manual mode, please set a mode other than "Custom Color")
6. Return to CMD input,type following command
    "DDM /ImportSettings C:\temp\DDMsettings.json" 
7. Confirm whether DDM successfully imported the configuration file

Result: The Color preset will be set to Custom color.
Expectation: After entering the import command, DDM should import the color mode previously set by the user.

chinese: [DDM 2.3.1] - A-Can : 使用外接4K/6K螢幕，視窗透過Snap拖曳選擇monitor 1至筆電時，外接螢幕仍然看得到該視窗的邊角
title: [DDM 2.3.1] - A-Can: When connecting 4K/6K Monitor, moving a folder to the laptop screen using Window Snap does not completely move it off the external screen.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.1.11
PCmodel:Dell Precision 7560
OS version : Windows 10 Pro (22H2),19045.4170
Graphics Chipset: NVIDIA T1200 Laptop GPU


Monitor / FW : U3219Q / M3B012 (4K)
Input Source : DP
Monitor / FW : U3224KB / M2T106(6K)
Input Source : Thunderbolt
description:
1. Connect the 4K/6K monitor to the laptop.
2. Open OS Display Settings > Rearrange your displays > Set laptop monitor 1 to the right, and set external monitor 2 to the left. The numbers 1 and 2 need to be aligned left and right.
3. Open the software > Main Menu > Easy Arrange > Settings
4. Turn on the application window snapshot function.
5. Open any window (for example: File Explorer).
6. First drag the window to the upper left of the external monitor 2 screen (the window needs to be on the far left) > then drag the window through Snap to select the monitor 1 laptop.

Result: When the external monitor (Monitor 2) File Explorer clicks the laptop (Monitor 1) through Snap dragging, the corners of the File Explorer are still visible on the external monitor (Monitor 2)
Expectation: When the external monitor (Monitor 2) File Explorer clicks on the laptop (monitor 1) through Snap dragging, the corners of the window should be completely within the laptop monitor 1.

python.exe flood.skvm.py -i [PC IP address of target] -p 5567 -c y

description:

1. No monitor is connected.
2. Open the command prompt Type "netstat -a"
3. Check the 3 Network KVM ports: Incoming port, Outgoing port, Content Transfer port.
4. Connect a DDM/DDPM supported monitor but does not support Network KVM

6. Check the 3 Network KVM ports: Incoming port, Outgoing port, Content Transfer port.
7. Connect a DDM/DDPM not supported monitor to PC1.
8. Open the command prompt Type "netstat -a"
9. Check the 3 Network KVM ports: Incoming port, Outgoing port, Content Transfer port.

Result: 5566,5567 can be found on 
 1. The screen is not connected.
 2. The screen is not supported NKVM.
 3. The screen is not supported DDM.
Expectation: 5566,5567 cannot be found.

title: [DDM 2.3.2] Release 2 : After upgrading the old version of DDM to the latest version, the Advanced button is missing on the Color page.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.2.3
PC1 model: Alienware M16 R1
OS version: Windows 11 Pro (23H2),22631.3737
Graphics Chipset: NVIDIA GeForce RTX4080 Laptop GPU

Monitor/FW: U2424HE/M3B102
Input Source: C to C
description:
1. Install the previous DDM (if there is already DDM in the system, please uninstall the previous DDM).
2. Prepare the latest DDM installer (2.3.2.3).
3. Open the command prompt from the PC. (Search for "cmd")
4. Enter the cd command to the latest DDM folder.
"Example: cd c:\[folder name]"
5. Type the following command to install the latest DDM:
"start ddmsetup /verysilent"
6. After installing the latest version of DDM, check whether there is an Advanced button on the Color page under the main menu.

Result: Advanced button on the Colors page after installing to the latest version of DDM.
Expectation: After installing to the latest version of DDM, the Colors page should have an Advanced button.

title: [DDM 2.3.2] Release 2 : After installing DDM, the consent page does not prompt the user.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.2.3
PC1 model: Thena NQ Inspiron-7441
BIOS version:1.6.0
OS version: Windows 11 Pro (24H2),26100.712
Graphics Chipset: Qualcomm(R) Adreno(TM) X1-85 GPU
Graphics Chipset version: 31.0.60.1

PC2 model: ASUS ZenBook 14 UX435EG
OS version: Windows 10Pro (22H2),19045.4651
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics or NVIDIA GeForde MX450

Monitor / FW : U3425WE / M3B102
Input Source :  Thunderbolt
description:
1. Open File Explorer in the operating system
2. Move to "C:\Windows\System32\oobe\info\userchoices.xml"
3. Rename userchoices.xml to something else.
4. Prepare the latest DDM installer (2.3.2.3).
5. Open the command prompt from the PC. (Search for "cmd")
6. Enter the cd command to the latest DDM folder.
    "Example: cd c:\[folder name]"
7. Type the following command to install the latest DDM:
    "start ddmsetup /verysilent" 
     "start ddmsetup /silent"
     "start ddmsetup /silent /Telemetryconsent"
8. After installing the latest version of DDM, 
 a. Connect the monitor and click the DDM icon in the system tray
 b. Exit DDM and launch DDM from Program menu. 


Result:
1. Click DDM in the system tray,  DDM consent page does not prompt the user.
2. Exit DDM and launch DDM from the program menu, DDM consent page does not prompt the user.

Expectation:
1. Click on DDM from system tray, DDM Consent page is prompted for the user.
2. Exit DDM and launch DDM from Program menu, DDM Consent page is prompted for the user.


Note: Non Dell Platform state will also cause the above problem.

chinese: [DDM 2.3.2] Release 3 : 舊版本DDM安裝至最新版本後，Color management的設定不會被複製。
title: [DDM 2.3.2] Release 3: After installing DDM to the latest version, the original Color management settings are not copied over.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.2.4
PC1 model: Alienware M16 R1
OS version: Windows 11 Pro (23H2),22631.3737
Graphics Chipset: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4080 Laptop GPU

Monitor/FW: U2424HE/M3B102
Input Source: C to C
description:
Test Case: Software installation using CLI #89-90 #93-94 #97-98 #101-102  Step 4 Expected Result
1. Install the previous DDM (if there is already DDM in the system, please uninstall the previous DDM).
2. Turn on DDM
     a. Click DDM icon > Main Menu > Others > Color management
            (for 2.0.0.135, 2.1.0.45, 2.1.1.17 version)
     b. Click DDM icon > Main Menu > Color > Advanced
            (for 2.2.0.43 version)
3. Select one of the following options after tick Color management
4. Prepare the latest DDM installer (2.3.2.4 version).
5. Open the command prompt from the PC. (Search for ""cmd"")
6. Enter the cd command to the latest DDM folder.
    "Example: cd c:\[folder name]"
7. Type the following command to install the latest DDM:
    "start ddmsetup /verysilent"
    "start ddmsetup /verysilent /installfeature=networkKVM"
8. After installing the latest version of DDM, open DDM
9. Click DDM icon > Main Menu > Color > Advanced
10. Verify whether the Color management settings have been copied from the old version of DDM to the latest version

Result: After installing the latest version of DDM, the color management settings are not copied from the old version to the new version.
Expectation: After installing the latest version of DDM, the color management settings should be copied from the old version to the new version.
Note: The old DDM versions installed according to the case requirements are 2.0.0.135, 2.1.0.45, 2.1.1.17 and 2.2.0.43

     Enter "ddm /fwupdate defer"

chinese: [DDM 2.3.2] - Release 5: USB KVM Settings 設定Input source & USB upstream cable異常

system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.2.7
PC1 model: Dell - Latitude 5410
OS version: Windows 10 Pro 22H2, 19045. 4780
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) UHD Graphics

Monitor / FW : U3225QE / 22T101
Input Source :  Thunderbolt
description:
Scenario 1: 
1. Open software main menu > KVM
2. Select USB KVM and click Next.
3. Use Thunderbolt cable as the connecting video cable to PC. 
4. Check the upstream option of "Connect USB cables to PCs"

Result: The option is still displayed.  
Expectation: If the video cable selects Thunderbolt/USB, the option for selecting upstream is not supposed to be displayed.

Scenario 2: 
1. Open software main menu > KVM
2. Select on USB KVM and click Next.
3. On PC1, selecting DP/HDMI as input and click Next.  
4. On PC2, check the video cable options.

Result:  The video cable selected for PC1 is still displayed for PC2.
Expectation: If the video cable is already selected for PC1, it shouldn't be displayed for PC2.

description:

    a) DUT1 connects to PC1.
    b) PC1 connected to network.
2. On PC1, Open Software > Main Menu > KVM > proceed until completion.
3. Click Add PC.

description:
Test case: DO Integration #3-3 #4-3 
Setup: 
a) Platform must be Dell Latitude, Dell OptiPlex or Dell Precision launched after March 2020.
b) Make sure DO and DDM is not installed. If there is a installation, please uninstall and proceed.
 
Test Steps:
 
1. Download A-rev n-1 DO(4.1.353.0) from Dell website, and X-rev(4.2.0.0-26) from cloud server. 
** Open browser, search your "platform name" and go to Driver & Download in Dell website. Search "Dell Optimizer Application", click arrow to expand, then click on "older versions". click on the top version in the list to download and install.
 
Result: Both version of DO installer stop itself when installing (Exit Code in installation log of 4.1.353.0: DEP_HARD_ERROR)
Expectation: Both DO installer should successfully install and working as expected

Note: Dell Latitude 9520 can successfully install 4.1.353.0 & 4.2.0.0-26 version DO.

description:
Testcase : Network KVM Connectivity #50-2 #51-2

1. Setup:
   -PC1 connect to Windows OS (or Mac OS)
   -PC2 connect to Windows OS
2. Launch DDM.
3. On PC1, Open Software > Main Menu > KVM > proceed until completion > Add PC2.
4. PC2 account is logout. (at login screen).
5. Wait for 5 mins, move the mouse in PC1 and use PC1's keyboard to login for PC2. 

Result: PC2 is unable to login successfully using Network KVM from Keyboard and Mouse are connected to PC1.
Expectation: PC2 is able to login successfully using Network KVM from Keyboard and Mouse are connected to PC1.

description:

1. DUT connects to PC.
2. Open software > main menu > Easy Arrange > create custom layout
3. Check custom layout

Result :  After adding a custom layout, the newly added layout is not displayed on the custom layout.
Expectation :  After adding a custom layout, the newly added layout should be displayed on the custom layout.


Test case：Easy Arrange #14~21 #33 #53
1. Open software > main menu > Easy Arrange > Layout.
2. Select one of the predefined layout. Clicks on the pencil icon
3. Check the default name for "Customize Layout Friendly Name"
4. Edit the name.
5. Click Save. 
6. Mouse over the custom layout icon.
7. Click pencil icon on custom layout.

Result：Custom layout save in 5. not shows under "Custom", there's no pencil icon to click.
Expectation：Custom layout save in 5. should shows under "Custom", and there's pencil icon can click to edit it.

Monitor1/FW: U2724D / M3B102
Input Source: DP + USB upstream (USB-A to B)
description:
Test Case:  Firmware update using CLI #29

1. Both DUT same mode (U2724D) and Both HAVE FW available. 
2. Setup (MST) : PC > C to DP cable + USB upstream (USB-A to B) > DUT1 > DP + USB upstream (USB-A to B) > DUT2.
3. Exit DDM
4. Launch Command Prompt as Admin 
5. Type " cd C:\Program Files\Dell\Dell Display Manager 2 "
6. Type command to update : ddm /fwupdate force 

Result: There is a probability both DUTs will lose signal during firmware updates. (Failure Rate:1/3)
Expectation: Both DUTs are detected normally, and both firmware updates are successful.

Note: 
1. After unplugging and plugging the input source from the PC, both DUTs still updated successfully, and DDM notification displayed "updated successfully."
2. Both DUTs have a probability of going into standby mode after DUT1 or DUT2 flashes a black screen.  
3. Intel: Dell Laititude 5410 there is no such issue.

description:

Expectation: Switching clusters does not allow disconnection from happening.

chinese: [DDM 2.3.2] - Release 7: Windows連Mac會造成 hotkey sync重複
title: [DDM 2.3.2] - Release 7: Connecting to Mac PC causes a duplicate hotkey.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.2.10
PC model: ASUS-FX516PM
OS version: Windows 10 Home(22H2),19045.4780
Graphics Chipset: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060 6G
DDPM Version: v1.3.2.0010
PC1 model: M1 MacBook Pro 
OS version: OS15.0

Monitor / FW : C3422WE / M2T112
Input Source : HDMI
Monitor/FW: U3223QZ, M2T105
Input source: C to C
description:
1. Setup:
    - On Windows PC:
       Set "Ctrl+Q" for "Switch between PC's hotkey"
       Set "None" for "Restore the mouse cursor to a local computer"
    - On Mac PC:
       Set "None" for "Switch between PC's hotkey"
       Set "Ctrl+Q" for "Restore the mouse cursor to a local computer" 
2. On Windows PC, add that Mac PC as multiple display.
3. Check those two hotkey settings.

Result: 
On Mac PC, it will prompt a warning dialog and not sync. The settings are as follows:
"Switch between PC's hotkey" : "Ctrl+Q"
"Restore the mouse cursor to a local computer" : "None"
On Windows PC, no message pops up. The settings are as follows:
"Switch between PC's hotkey" : "Ctrl+Q"
"Restore the mouse cursor to a local computer" : "Ctrl+Q"

Expectation: A duplicate hotkey is not permitted.

Note: For Windows-to-Windows connections, a warning notification pops up in the taskbar, preventing the formation of duplicate hotkeys.

description:

system_information:

OS Version:Windows 11 Home,22631.4169
Graphics Chipset:NVIDIA Geforce RTX3070 Laptop GPU

Monitor / FW : U2422HE / M3B409
Input Source : HDMI
description:
Test case: Network KVM Security #4 #5 #10 #11 #17 #18 #23 #24 Network KVM Setup #58-5#59-5

Scenario 1:
1. Setup Network KVM on both PC1 and PC2.
2. On PC3, open command Prompt from PC. (search for "cmd").
3. Enter cd command to the location of python script (flood.skvm.py).
4. Enter command to flood PC1's Incoming Port (Default =5567) using correct PING package:
    python.exe flood.skvm.py -i [PC1 IP address of target] -p 5567 -c p
5. Click "Here" Button.

Scenario 2:
1. Setup:
    a) DUT connects to 2 PC.
    b) PC connected to network. 
2. On PC1, Open Software > Main Menu > KVM > proceed until completion.
3. Click Add PC button.
4. Enter PC2's IP Address.
5. On PC1, enter the wrong PIN code. Repeat this step for 10 times.
6. On PC2, Click " Here" Button

Result: No response from Click "Here" Button.
Expectation: Click "Here" Button will prompt user to KVM Settings page.

chinese: [DDM 2.3.2] - Release 7 :  Input registry validation
title: [DDM 2.3.2]-Release 7: Input registry validation fail.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.2.10
PC2 model:  Precision 3560
OS version: Windows 11 Pro (23H2) 22631.4169
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Graphics

Monitor /FW: U2722D, M3T107
Input Source: HDMI
description:
1. Press "Win+R" to open Registry editor.
2. Download the excel file from testcase.
3. Follow the instruction and input an invalid value for each corresponding path file.
4. Check DDM status.

Result: 
- The FW update will eventually succeed even if an invalid value is input during the update process.
- Notifications are inconsistent: some do not appear, some are incorrect, and others are successful.
- Some values, once modified with an invalid value, remain unchanged and never revert.

Expectation:
- For an invalid value is input during the update process., the FW update will eventually fail, but DDM won't crash.
- For other cases, DDM will ignore this datum, won't crash.

description:

Note: ICC profile already installed. 
4. Go to main menu > color > Advanced.
5. Open software > main menu > Color > Advanced > Select "Automatically adjust the ICC color profile based on color preset".
 
Turn off PC Network connection and proceed step 6.
6. Delete the color profile.
MacOS: Go to Macintosh HD/Users/[username]/Applications/DDPM/Profiles/[Monitor Model]
Windows: C:\Windows\System32\spool\drivers\color
7. Launch software > main menu > Color. 
8. In software, go to Color section > manual > select a preset that has color profile.
 
Turn ON PC Network connection and proceed step 9.
9. Launch software > main menu > Color. 
10. In software, go to Color section > manual > select a preset that has color profile.

Result：System notification displayed: Unable to synchronize the corresponding ICC profile for [U2424H].
Expectation：ICC profile is selected according to color preset selected in software.

description:
Test case: Network KVM Connectivity #31#33#34
1. Launch DDPM > Main Menu > KVM > proceed until completion > Add PC2 and PC3
2. Unplug the input source from PC2.
3. Confirm that PC1,PC2 and PC3 are disconnected.

This behavior only occurs when unplugging the input port on either Windows Intel PC or ARM PC.
Expectation: On any of the PCs (PC1, PC2, or PC3), after unplugging and reconnecting the input source, the connection will automatically restore

title: [DDPM Win 2.0.0] - R18: After setting a valid non-default port, configuring an invalid port doesn't revert to default.
system_information:
DDPM version: 2.0.0.55
PC model: HP-Elite-Dragonfly G2
OS version: Windows10 Pro (22H2) 19045.5131
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor / FW : U3219Q / M3B012
Input Source : C
description:
test case : Network KVM Settings #8 9 #10

Setup:
a) Install Network KVM from UI.
b) DUT connects to 2 PCs.
c) All PCs connected to same network.
d) Setup Network KVM.

1. In PC1, Enter : "CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVMIncomingPort -value=5000" (valid port)
2. Exit and Launch the Software.
3. In PC1, Enter : "CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVMIncomingPort -value=0" (invalid port)
4. Exit and Launch the Software.
5. Enter the command " netstat -a ".
6. Find port 5566 in the list 

Result: Found port 1024 instead of 5566 . 
Expectation: For testcase requirement, if set an invalid port, that port will return default port 5566. 

Note : OutgoingPort , ContentTransferPort has the same problem.

DDPM version: 2.0.0.59
PC model: Microsoft Surface Laptop, 7th Edition
OS version: Win11 Home ,26100.2454

description:
1. Use administrator to open CMD.
2. Enter "cd C:\Program Files\Dell\Dell Display and Peripheral Manager\Plugins\CLI.Subagent".
3. Enter "CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVM -value=disable".
4. Enter "CLI.Subagent /get -Display=NetworkKVM".
5. Click Off.
6. Click Open Network KVM.

Result: Network KVM cannot be started.
Expectation: Network KVM can be enabled.

Note: "CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVMAutoConnect -value=on"
"CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVMAutoConnect -value=off"
"CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVMContentTransfer -value=on"
"CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVMContentTransfer -value=off"
"CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVMIncomingPort -value=1024"
"CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVMOutgoingPort -value=1024"
"CLI.Subagent /set -Display=NetworkKVMContentTransferPort -value=1024" has this problem.

chinese: [DDM 2.3.2] - webpost patch: 當建立Symlink後DDM無法順利覆蓋 安裝 解安裝
title: [DDM 2.3.2] - webpost patch: After creating the symlink, DDM cannot successfully upgrade, uninstall or install.
system_information:
DDM version: 2.3.2.20

PC model: Precison 3560
OS version: Windows 11 Pro, (23H2) 22631.4602
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Xe Graphics

Monitor / FW : U3224KB, M2T107
Input Source : USB-C
description:
Testcase : Software Security #36, #45, #55 #66

Setup: 
1. Log in to the system with a Standard User Account.
2. Log in to the system and create a folder named "Test" under "C:\Program Files (x86)\". 
After the folder "Test" is created, create one folder under the "Test" directory named "Testing".

scenario1(Upgrade Flow) from Test Case ID 161429:
1. Navigate to the directory where the installers are downloaded. Initiate and complete the installation with the previous installer(n-1). 
2. Navigate to "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\ApplicationName" and open the terminal there.
3. Enter the following command to create a Symlink under "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\ApplicationName"
mklink /J Test “C:\Program Files (x86)\Test"
4. Navigate to the directory where the installers are downloaded. Initiate and complete the installation with the current installer. 

Result: A warning message pops up"The intallation/uninstallation cannot proceed because of a security issue.
Expectation: Application with the current version installed in the system. 


scenario 2(Uninstallation Flow) from Test Case ID 161331:
1. Navigate to the directory where the installer is downloaded and install the application under test. 
2. Navigate to "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local" and take note of the folder which has the application name.
3. Navigate to "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\ApplicationName" and open the terminal there.
4. Enter the following command to create a Symlink under "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local\ApplicationName"
mklink /J Test “C:\Program Files (x86)\Test"
5. Double-click on the Symlink "Test" and check if points to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Test". 
6. Initiate and complete the uninstallation process from the control panel. 

Result: A warning message pops up"The intallation/uninstallation cannot proceed because of a security issue.
Expectation: The application under test is uninstalled. 


scenario 3(Installation Flow) from Test Case ID 161150:
1. Navigate to "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local" and open terminal there. 
2. Enter the following command to create a Symlink under "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local" mklink /J Test “C:\Program Files (x86)\Test"
3. Double-click on the Symlink "Test" and check if points to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Test". 
4. Rename the Symlink with the name "Test" to "Dell Display Manager".
5. Navigate to the directory where the installer is downloaded and start the installation. 

Result: A warning message pops up"The intallation/uninstallation cannot proceed because of a security issue.
Expectation: The installation process starts. 


scenario 4(Uninstallation Flow) from Test Case ID 161162:
1. Navigate to the directory where the installer is downloaded and install the application under test. 
2. Close the application(If running) and delete the folder which is created in the previous step.
3. Navigate to "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local" and open terminal there. 
4. Enter the following command to create a Symlink under "C:\Users\Username\AppData\Local"
mklink /J Test “C:\Program Files (x86)\Test"
5. Double-click on the Symlink "Test" and check if points to "C:\Program Files (x86)\Test". 
6. Rename the Symlink with the name "Test" to "Dell Display Manager".
7. Initiate and complete the uninstallation process from the control panel. 
Result: A warning message pops up"The intallation/uninstallation cannot proceed because of a security issue.
Expectation: The application under test is uninstalled. 

Note: 
1. This phenomenon also occur on ARM PC.
PC model: Micosoft Surface Pro, 11th Edition 
OS version: Window11 home(24H2) 26100.2454
Graphics Chipset: Qualcomm(R) Adreno(TM) X1-85 GPU

1. Install DDMv2.3.2.22 
2. Open Software, change some hotkey, color auto mode etc. setup. Please remember the settings. 
3. Open command prompt, type "DDM /TestMode On"
4. Go to update page, clicks Update Button.
5. Wait for DDPM v66 update completed.
6. Check whether items that were set in Step 2 still persist.

Result: Settings such as hotkey assignments and color auto mode are not inherited.
Expectation:  DDM settings are supposed to be preserved within DDPM after updating.

Note : 
some DDM settings are not preserved as follows :
1. Brightness / Contrast : hotkey
2. Input Source : list & hotkey
3. Color : auto list
4. Easy Arrange : Recent、Custom & Settings
5. KVM : USB-KVM
6. Other : Power Nap、Application Settings
7. Consent page : After the DDM click consent page, the DDPM pops up the consent page
8. DDPM installation process is not show ask for NKVM installation windows after updating form DDM without NKVM.

chinese: [DDPM Win 2.0.0]: Single模式下Sleep / Hibernate醒來後會變Mult
title: [DDPM Win 2.0.0]: After waking up from sleep/hibernate in single display mode may result in multiple display mode.
system_information:
DDPM Windows version: 2.0.0.66
DDPM MAC version: 2.0.0.0010
PC model  : Dell Pricision 3560 
OS version : Windows 11 Pro 23H2 (22631.4602) 
Graphics Chipset: AMD Radeon(TM) Graphics
PC model : MacBook Pro
OS version : Sequoia 15.2
Graphics Chipset: Intel(R) Iris(R) Plus Graphics

Monitor1 / FW : U2724DE, M3T102
Input Source1 :  HDMI
Input Source2:  USB-C
description:
Network KVM Connectivity #19-3 #19-5
1. 
Setup: (Both PC different OS, use one Windows and one macOS)
a) Set to PBP layout.
b) DUT connects to 2 PCs.
c) All PCs connected to same network.
d) Setup Network KVM successfully.
e) PC2 has to go to DDPM app > KVM > Network KVM and click on it. 

Scenario1:
1. Set PC2 is sleep mode.(for PC1 = Mac, PC2 = Windows)
2. Wait for 5 mins, In PC2 wake up PC2. 

Scenario2:
1. PC2 is hibernate mode.(for PC1 = Mac, PC2 = Windows)
2. Wait for 5 mins, In PC2 wake up PC2 from hibernate. 


Result: After waking up from sleep/hibernate in single display mode may result in multiple display mode. (Sleep mode probability: 2/5, Hibernate mode probability: 1/10)
Expectation: After waking up from sleep/hibernate in single display mode, UI should remain in single display mode.
Note: 
1.Test with all same OS (Windows & ARM) has no problem.
2. This phenomenon also occur on ARM PC.
PC model: Micosoft Surface Pro, 11th Edition 
OS version: Window11 home(24H2) 26100.2605
Graphics Chipset: Qualcomm(R) Adreno(TM) X1-85 GPU
